analyzed: evam ca iha vidhi uddeśa antargatyā ākṣepam samādhāya uttara adhikaraṇeṣu guṇa vidhi tva āśaṅkā nirāsena nāmadheya tvena tad antargatiḥ sādhyate iti sarvam anavadyam iti
translated: And thus, having resolved the objection by inclusion within the injunctive statement here, it is established by the refutation of the doubt of being an injunction of a subordinate element in the subsequent sections that it is included within that by being a name. Thus, everything is faultless.

analyzed: bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the idea.

analyzed: udbhid soma ādi padānām stāvaka tayā anupayogaḥ
translated: The words udbhid, soma, etc. are not useful as mere praise

analyzed: vidhi uddeśa ādi anantargata tve upapādanīye udbhedana kartṛ tva guṇa yogena saṃbhāvita stuti pratīteḥ nirāsāya arthavāda tvam tāvat nirākaroti stuti buddheḥ iti
translated: When it is to be established that they are not immediately connected with the injunctive statement, in order to remove the understanding of praise that is possible by the connection with the quality of having the nature of piercing, he first refutes their being arthavada statements with the words because of the understanding of praise.

analyzed: na vā vidhi eka vākya tā mātreṇa arthavāda tvam bhavati
translated: Or, being an arthavada statement does not occur merely by being syntactically connected with an injunction.

analyzed: bhūti kāma ādi padānām api tad āpatteḥ
translated: because in that case the words 'desiring prosperity' etc. would also be so.

analyzed: apitu vidhi śeṣa tvena
translated: But as a subordinate part of an injunction.

analyzed: na hi ayam vidhi śeṣaḥ
translated: This is not a subordinate part of an injunction.

analyzed: navā vidhi antargatena eka padena guṇa guṇi saṃbandha kīrtana ātmaka stuti dhiyaḥ utpattiḥ
translated: Nor is there an origination of the idea of praise consisting in the recital of the relation between the quality and the qualified by a single word contained within the injunction.

analyzed: yadi api vā utpadyeta
translated: Even if it were to originate.

original: tathāpi vāyurvai kṣepiṣṭhetivat prathamāyā evāpattau tṛtīyopāttakaraṇatvānupapattiriti nārthavādatvamityarthaḥ //🔽mantra ityevaṃvidhābhiyuktaprasiddhiviṣayatvarūpasya mukhyamantralakṣaṇasya vidhitaccheṣatvabhinnatvarūpasya
analyzed: tathā api vāyuḥ vai kṣepiṣṭhā iti vat prathamāyāḥ eva āpattau tṛtīya upātta karaṇa tva anupapattiḥ iti na arthavāda tvam iti arthaḥ  mantraḥ iti evaṃvidha abhiyukta prasiddhi viṣaya tva rūpasya mukhya mantra lakṣaṇasya vidhi tad śeṣa tva bhinna tva rūpasya
translated: Still, just as in 'Vayu is the swiftest', when the first case ending is used, the use of the instrumental ending in the third case is not possible. Therefore the meaning is that it is not a commendatory passage.🔽Because of the absence of the primary characteristic of a mantra, which is the nature of being the object of the well-known usage of the learned as 'mantra', or🔽because of the absence of the all-pervading characteristic of being different from being an injunction or its subordinate part,

analyzed: vā vyāpaka lakṣaṇasya abhāvena mukhya mantra tva anupapatteḥ na mantra antargatiḥ iti āha
translated: the non-applicability of being a primary mantra is stated by saying

analyzed: mantra tva prasiddhi abhāva iti
translated: 'because of the absence of the well-known usage of being a mantra'.

analyzed: na api ūha pravara nāmadheyānām iva mukhya mantra tva abhāve pi anuṣṭheya artha smāraka tayā mukhya mantra kārya kara tvāt gauṇa mantra tvam api saṃbhavati iti āha
translated: Even though there is no primary mantra-hood like the names of the Nāikas and Pravaras, the secondary mantra-hood is also possible because of the ability to perform the function of a primary mantra by reminding of the object to be performed, it is said

analyzed: eteṣām iti
translated: 'of these'.

analyzed: mantra tvena vidhi uddeśa tvena ca anupayoga samarthanam  na tāvat brāhmaṇa eka vākya tayā anuṣṭheya artha smāraka tva saṃbhavaḥ
translated: The establishment of the uselessness of the mantra as an injunction.🔽First, it is not possible for it to be a reminder of what is to be performed by being syntactically connected with the Brāhmaṇa text.

original: yajeta paśukāma ityādeḥ brāhmaṇavākyasya vidhāyakatvena karmakālāprayojyatvāt tadekavākyatāpannasyāsya tadanupapatteḥ /
analyzed: yajeta paśu kāmaḥ ityādeḥ brāhmaṇa vākyasya vidhāyaka tvena karma kāla aprayojya tvāt tad ekavākya tā āpannasya asya tad anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the Brāhmaṇa text beginning with one desiring cattle should sacrifice is injunctive, and is not related to the time of the ritual, this [mantra] which is syntactically connected with that cannot be a reminder.

analyzed: na api pṛthak bhūta tvena
translated: Nor is it as a separate [entity].

analyzed: etat abhidheyasya khanitra ādeḥ karmaṇi avidhānāt eva prakāśana anarha tvāt
translated: Because the object denoted by this [mantra], the ritual of digging the hole etc., is not enjoined in the ritual, it is not fit to be illuminated.

analyzed: na ca upāṃśu yāga vat eva sannidhāna avagata yāga aṅga tva nirvāhāya māntravarṇika dravya vidhi kalpanayā smāraka tva upapattiḥ
translated: And it is not proper for it to be a reminder by the assumption of an injunction of a substance based on the words of the mantra, in order to establish its being an auxiliary to the sacrifice understood through proximity, as in the case of the Upāṃśuyāja.

analyzed: dravyasya bhāvanāyām yāge vā anvaya asaṃbhavena tad vidhi kalpanā anupapatteḥ
translated: Because it is not possible to assume an injunction of that [substance], due to the impossibility of syntactical connection of the substance with the bhāvanā or the sacrifice.

original: yāgajanakatvenākāṅkṣāyā arthākṣiptadravyeṇaiva nirāsāt na tadbalena bhāvanāyā ākāṅkṣantarakalpanayāpyanvayo yukta iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: yāga janaka tvena ākāṅkṣāyāḥ artha ākṣipta dravyeṇa eva nirāsāt na tad balena bhāvanāyāḥ ākāṅkṣa antara kalpanayā api anvayaḥ yuktaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that it is not proper to connect [the mantra] with the bhāvanā by assuming another requirement based on the power of that [mantra], because the requirement of being the cause of the sacrifice is removed by the substance implied by the meaning itself.

analyzed: vidhi uddeśa rūpa veda avayava antarbhāvam nirasyati na ca iti
translated: He rejects the inclusion of the mantra as a part of the Veda in the form of an injunction with the words Nor is it.
In the prima facie view, the purposefulness of the injunction to study is established.

analyzed: spaṣṭa akṣaram adhikaraṇa pūrvapakṣa antam  na ca evam pūrvapakṣe sādhita adhyayana vidhi dṛṣṭārtha tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: The prima facie view of the section is stated in clear words up to the end.🔽And thus, in the prima facie view, the purposefulness of the injunction to study, which has been established, is not contradicted.

analyzed: tasya pārāyaṇe pi upayogi prayoga prāśu bhāva rūpa dṛṣṭārtha tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Because that purposefulness in the form of the quick attainment of practice, which is useful even in recitation, is not contradicted.

analyzed: tasya pārāyaṇe pi upayogi prayoga prāśu bhāva rūpa dṛṣṭārtha tayā upapatteḥ apramāṇam mudbhida ādi śabdāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the words such as udbhid are not valid, because it is possible to establish that purposefulness in the form of the quick attainment of practice, which is useful even in recitation.

analyzed: vidhi uddeśa antarbhāvena siddhāntaḥ
translated: The conclusion is that they are valid because they are included in the injunction.

original: adhyayanagatadṛṣṭārthatānirvāhe 'pi prayojanavadarthajñānārthatvasya sādhitasyābhaṅgāya prāmāṇyamastīti siddhāntamāha adhyayaneti //
analyzed: adhyayana gata dṛṣṭārtha tā nirvāhe pi prayojanavat artha jñāna artha tvasya sādhitasya abhaṅgāya prāmāṇyam asti iti siddhāntam āha adhyayana iti
translated: Even though the purposefulness in the study is established, in order to avoid the contradiction of the established purpose of knowing the meaning of the useful, he states the conclusion with adhyayanam etc.

analyzed: tatra prakāra asaṃbhave pi ityasya prakāra antara asaṃbhave pi iti arthaḥ
translated: There, even though the mode is not possible means even though another mode is not possible.

analyzed: iti prathamam udbhida ādi pada prāmāṇya adhikaraṇam
translated: Thus ends the first section on the validity of words like udbhid.
Section

analyzed: api vā nāmadheyam
translated: Or it is a name.

original: ataḥ paraṃ kva guṇavidhitvaṃ kva vā nāmadheyatvamiti koṣṭhaśodhanikārthamārambhaḥ /
analyzed: atas param kva guṇa vidhi tvam kva vā nāmadheya tvam iti koṣṭha śodhanika artham ārambhaḥ
translated: Henceforth, where is the enjoining of a quality, and where is the mere naming? The commencement is for the purpose of purifying the womb.

original: tadiha guṇe karmaṇi ca tulyavadvṛttikānāmudbhidādipadānāṃ vidheyaguṇasamarpakatvaṃ
analyzed: tat iha guṇe karmaṇi ca tulya vat vṛttikānām udbhida ādi padānām vidheya guṇa samarpaka tvam
translated: Here, in the case of words like udbhid, which function equally with respect to a quality and an action, the propriety is that they convey the quality to be enjoined,

original: nāmadheyatvaṃ veti cintāyāṃ bhidir vidāraṇe iti smṛtyā vidāraṇasamarthakhanitrādivacanatvaprasiddhernāmadheyatve
analyzed: nāmadheya tvam vā iti cintāyām bhidiḥ vidāraṇe iti smṛtyā vidāraṇa samartha khanitra ādi vacanatva prasiddheḥ nāmadheya tve
translated: or that they are mere names. In the consideration of this, due to the well-known meaning of words like bhid (to split) as referring to a spade etc. capable of splitting, if they were mere names,

analyzed: vaiyarthya prasaṅgāt ca guṇa vidhi tvam eva yuktam
translated: there would be the undesirable consequence of uselessness. Therefore, it is proper that they enjoin a quality.

original: tatraca guṇaviśiṣṭaṃ karmaiva phaloddeśena vidhīyata ityekaḥ pakṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca guṇa viśiṣṭam karma eva phala uddeśena vidhīyate iti ekaḥ pakṣaḥ
translated: And in this regard, one view is that the action qualified by the quality is enjoined with reference to the result.

analyzed: prakṛta soma yāga anuvādena guṇa mātra vidhānam iti aparaḥ
translated: Another view is that there is the mere enjoining of the quality by way of a restatement of the original Soma sacrifice.

analyzed: na ca vinigamanā virahaḥ
translated: And there is no absence of a basis for discrimination.

analyzed: itikartavya tā sannidhi viśeṣasya eva karma vidhi niyāmaka tvāt
translated: Because the specification of the proximity of the manner of performance is itself the determiner of the injunction of the action.

analyzed: na ca evam phala pada ānarthakyam
translated: And thus there is no uselessness of the word denoting the result.

original: sarvebhyo jyotiṣṭoma iti vacanena tasya sarvaphalārthatvāvagateryajipadasya paśuphalopadhāyakayāgalakṣaṇāyāṃ tātparyagrāhakatvāt /
analyzed: sarvebhyaḥ jyotiṣṭomaḥ iti vacanena tasya sarva phala artha tva avagateḥ yaji padasya paśu phala upadhāyaka yāga lakṣaṇāyām tātparya grāhaka tvāt
translated: Because, when it is understood that the Jyotiṣṭoma is for all results by the statement for all, and the word yaji (in the injunction yajeta) has the purpose of indicating the sacrifice characterized by the result of animals, it is the indicator of the purport.

analyzed: atas eva na viśiṣṭa uddeśe vākya bhedaḥ
translated: For this very reason, there is no syntactical split in the injunction of a qualified [action].

analyzed: na ca utpatti śiṣṭa soma prābalyam
translated: And there is no overriding of the Soma prescribed in the originative injunction.

analyzed: paśu kāma prayoga viśeṣa puraskāreṇa vihitasya khanitra ādeḥ sāmānya vihita soma ādi bādhaka tvāt
translated: Because the Khinitra, etc., enjoined with reference to the particular application of one desiring cattle, overrides the Soma, etc., enjoined in general.

original: vastutastu prakṛtasomayāgāśritaḥ khanitrādiguṇa eva phaloddeśena vidhīyate iti tṛtīyaḥ pakṣaḥ /
analyzed: vastutas tu prakṛta soma yāga āśritaḥ khanitra ādi guṇaḥ eva phala uddeśena vidhīyate iti tṛtīyaḥ pakṣaḥ
translated: But in reality, the third alternative is that the quality of Khinitra, etc., based on the Soma sacrifice in question, is enjoined with reference to the result.

original: kāmyatvādeva ca nityasomabādha iti prāpte brūmaḥ nāyaṃ guṇavidhiḥ / gauravāt /
analyzed: kāmya tvāt eva ca nitya soma bādhaḥ iti prāpte brūmaḥ na ayam guṇa vidhiḥ gauravāt
translated: And because it is optional, it overrides the obligatory Soma. This being the prima facie view, we say: This is not an injunction of a quality, because of the great difficulty [involved in such an interpretation].

original: tathāhi sarvatraiva tāvacchruddhadhātvarthakaraṇakabhāvanāvidhānādādyo vidhiprakāraḥ yathāgnihotraṃ juhotī ti /
analyzed: tathā hi sarvatra eva tāvat śruddha dhātvartha karaṇaka bhāvanā vidhānāt ādyaḥ vidhi prakāraḥ yathā agnihotram juhoti iti
translated: For, to begin with, in every case, the first type of injunction is the injunction of the bhāvanā (which is the meaning of the verbal root), as in One should offer the Agnihotra.

original: anyoddeśena tadvidhiraparaḥ yathāgnihotraṃ juhuyāt svargakāma iti /
analyzed: anya uddeśena tad vidhiḥ aparaḥ yathā agnihotram juhuyāt svarga kāmaḥ iti
translated: Another is the injunction with reference to something else, as in One desiring heaven should offer the Agnihotra.

analyzed: etasya ca uddeśya vācaka pada antara sāpekṣa tvāt daurbalyam
translated: And this is weaker because it requires another word expressing the object of reference.

analyzed: dhātvartha uddeśena anya karaṇaka bhāvanā vidhiḥ tṛtīyaḥ yathā dadhnā juhoti iti
translated: The third is the injunction of a bhāvanā with a different instrument, as in One should offer with curd.

original: atra vidheyatāyā dhātvarthavṛttitvābhāvāt padāntarārthavṛttitvācca tato 'pi daurbalyam /
analyzed: atra vidheya tāyāḥ dhātvartha vṛtti tva abhāvāt pada antara artha vṛtti tvāt ca daurbalyam
translated: Here, because the state of being the content of an injunction does not occur in the meaning of the verbal root, and because it occurs in the meaning of another word, it is weaker than that.

analyzed: dhātoḥ sādhutva arthatvam aṅgīkṛtya anya uddeśena anya karaṇaka bhāvanā vidhiḥ caturthaḥ yathā dadhnā indriya kāmasya juhuyāt iti
translated: The fourth is the injunction of an action having a different means, accepting that the verbal root has the purpose of correctness, like One desiring the senses should offer with curd.

analyzed: atra dhātvarthasya uddeśya tvena api asaṃbandhāt daurbalyam
translated: Here, because the meaning of the verbal root is not related even as the content, it is weaker than that.

analyzed: guṇa viśiṣṭa dhātvartha karaṇaka bhāvanā vidhānāt pañcamaḥ yathā somena yajeta iti
translated: The fifth is the injunction of an action having the meaning of the verbal root qualified by an accessory, like One should sacrifice with soma.

analyzed: atra viśeṣaṇa vidhi kalpanā ādeḥ ādhikyāt tatas pi daurbalyam
translated: Here, because of the greater complexity of the assumption of an injunction of a qualifier, it is weaker than that.

original: anyoddeśena pūrvoktaḥ ṣaṣṭhaḥ yathā sauryaṃ caruṃ nirvaped brahmavarcasakāma iti /
analyzed: anya uddeśena pūrva uktaḥ ṣaṣṭhaḥ yathā sauryam carum nirvapet brahmavarcasa kāmaḥ iti
translated: The sixth mentioned earlier is with a different content, like One desiring spiritual radiance should offer a rice-gruel to Surya.

analyzed: ayantu sarva durbalaḥ
translated: But this is the weakest of all.

original: tadevaṃ udbhidguṇaviśiṣṭasya yāgasya phaloddeśena vidhāne ṣaṣṭhavidhiprakārāśrayaṇādatigauravam /
analyzed: tat evam udbhid guṇa viśiṣṭasya yāgasya phala uddeśena vidhāne ṣaṣṭha vidhi prakāra āśrayaṇāt ati gauravam
translated: Thus, in the injunction of a sacrifice qualified by the accessory udbhid with the purpose of a result, there is excessive complexity due to the reliance on the sixth type of injunction.

analyzed: guṇasya yāge na anvayāt matu artha lakṣaṇā ca
translated: Because of the connection of the accessory with the sacrifice, there is indication of the meaning of the word.

analyzed: nahi bhāvanāyām samāna pada upātta dhātvartha karaṇaka tva avaruddhāyām guṇasya karaṇa tvam saṃbhavati
translated: For when the meaning of the verbal root, which is mentioned by the same word as the bhāvanā, is restricted to being the instrument, it is not possible for the quality to be the instrument.

original: atastasya yāgānvayāvaśyakatve yāgasya kārakatvāt kārakāṇāṃ ca parasparaṃ saṃbandhānupapatteḥ somena yajetetivadudbhidvatā yāgeneti matvarthalakṣaṇā'vaśyakīti
analyzed: atas tasya yāga anvaya āvaśyaka tve yāgasya kāraka tvāt kārakāṇām ca parasparam saṃbandha anupapatteḥ somena yajeta iti vat udbhidvatā yāgena iti matu artha lakṣaṇa āvaśyakī iti
translated: Therefore, when it is necessary for it to be connected with the sacrifice, since the sacrifice is the agent, and since it is not possible for agents to be in mutual relation, just as in the case of 'one should sacrifice with soma', it is necessary to have secondary signification of the form 'with the possessor of the udumbara' in the sacrifice.

analyzed: prāñcaḥ
translated: This is the view of the ancient teachers.

original: vastutastu dṛṣṭānte 'pi somasya karaṇatvenaiva bhāvanāyāmevānvayastatra tatra vakṣyate /
analyzed: vastutas tu dṛṣṭānte somasya karaṇa tvena eva bhāvanāyām eva anvayaḥ tatra tatra vakṣyate
translated: But in reality, it will be said in various places that even in the example, soma is connected only as the instrument with the bhāvanā.

original: yuktaśca / ekakaraṇāvaruddhe 'pi karaṇāntarasya bhinnanirūpitasya prakāratayā bhāvanānvayopapatteḥ /
analyzed: yuktaḥ ca eka karaṇa avaruddhe pi karaṇa antarasya bhinna nirūpitasya prakāra tayā bhāvanā anvaya upapatteḥ
translated: And that is proper, because even when restricted to one instrument, the connection of another instrument, which is determined differently, is possible as a mode with the bhāvanā.

analyzed: nahi yāga karaṇa tvam bhāvanā nirūpitam
translated: For the sacrifice is not the instrument as determined by the bhāvanā.

analyzed: api tu svarga nirūpitam
translated: But rather, it is determined by heaven.

analyzed: atas ca yathā eva anya nirūpitam
translated: And therefore, just as the instrumentality determined by something else

analyzed: tad karaṇa tvam prakāratayā bhāvanāyām anveti
translated: is connected as a mode with the bhāvanā,

analyzed: tathā eva soma karaṇa tvam api yāga nirūpitam
translated: in the same way, the instrumentality of soma, which is determined by the sacrifice,

original: ubhayatra tattannirūpakatvasya pārṣṭhikabodhalabhyatvācca na ko 'pi virodha iti nāsminnapi pakṣe yadyapi matvarthalakṣaṇā /
analyzed: ubhayatra tad tad nirūpaka tvasya pārṣṭhika bodha labhya tvāt ca na kaḥ pi virodhaḥ iti na asmin api pakṣe yadi api matu artha lakṣaṇā
translated: And because the character of being the determiner of that and that is to be understood only from the subsequent cognition, there is no contradiction at all. Thus, even in this view, although there is indication of the possessive suffix,

analyzed: tathā api viśeṣaṇa vidhi kṛta
translated: nevertheless, it is due to the injunction of the qualifier.

analyzed: guṇa yāga ubhaya viśiṣṭa bhāvanā vidhi gauravam āpadyamānam nā upahnotum śakyam
translated: The heaviness of the injunction of the bhāvanā qualified by both the qualifier and the object cannot be denied.

original: yathāca prāthamikabhāvanāsaṃbandhāṅgīkāre 'pi dvitīyabodhavelāyāṃ matvarthakalpanā tathoktaṃ kaustubhe kalpanādi /
analyzed: yathā ca prāthamika bhāvanā saṃbandha aṅgīkāre dvitīya bodha velāyām matu artha kalpanā tathā uktam kaustubhe kalpanā ādi
translated: And just as even when the connection with the primary bhāvanā is accepted, the assumption of the possessive suffix occurs at the time of the second cognition, it has been stated in the Kautuhala that the assumption etc. are like that.

analyzed: evam dvitīya tṛtīyayoḥ api jaghanya vidhi prakāra aṅgīkaraṇam doṣāya
translated: Thus, even the acceptance of the inferior type of injunction in the second and third cases leads to a fault.

analyzed: agatyā ca dadhi soma ādau eva tat aṅgīkṛtam
translated: And it is accepted only in the case of curd and Soma, out of necessity.

analyzed: teṣām tatra atyanta rūḍha tvena nāmadheya tva asaṃbhavāt
translated: Because in those cases, due to the extremely well-established nature, it is not possible for them to be names.

original: prakṛte tu yenaiva yogena khanitre pravṛttistenaiva yogenodbhidyate utpādyate phalamiti vyutpattyā karmaṇyapīti nāmatvasaṃbhavena dvitīyavidhiprakārāṅgīkaraṇāllāghavam
analyzed: prakṛte tu yena eva yogena khanitre pravṛttiḥ tena eva yogena udbhidyate utpādyate phalam iti vyutpattyā karmaṇi api iti nāmatva saṃbhavena dvitīya vidhi prakāra aṅgīkaraṇāt lāghavam
translated: But in the present case, by the very same relation by which there is engagement in the spade, by that very relation the fruit is dug out, produced, by the etymological derivation, even in the case of the action, thus, there is lightness due to the acceptance of the second type of injunction, because it is possible for it to be a name.

original: naca bhido vidāraṇa eva smṛteḥ śaktiḥ /
analyzed: na ca bhidaḥ vidāraṇe eva smṛteḥ śaktiḥ
translated: And the potency of the word 'bhid' is remembered only in the sense of splitting.

analyzed: bhidiḥ iti eva dhātu pāṭhāt
translated: Because of the verbal root text (Dhātupāṭha) which has the form 'bhid' (meaning 'to split').

translated: Thus, the word 'udbhid' is not useless.

translated: For this very reason, the words 'soma' etc. do not have the nominal character in the sentence 'one should sacrifice with soma'.

analyzed: tatas ca saṃjñā tva nirvāha artham eva udbhida ādi śabdānām karmaṇi yoga āśrayaṇam iti

analyzed: tad vaiyarthya anavakāśaḥ

original: athavā udbhicchabdaḥ udbhicchabdābhidheyatvena rūpeṇa lakṣaṇayā karma pratipādayati /

translated: Or, the word 'udbhid' indicates the object by implication through the form of being denoted by the word 'udbhid'.

translated: And it should not be said that the variegatedness and femininity mentioned in separate injunctions cannot be included in the Agnīṣomīya sacrifice due to the exclusion of other qualities like the masculine gender and the black antelope skin which are relevant to that sacrifice.

analyzed: utpatti vākya gata paśu pade striyām api paśu śabda prayogeṇa puṃstvasya avivakṣita tvāt
translated: Because the masculine gender is not intended, as the word paśu (animal) is used for a female animal also in the originative injunction.

original: chāgasya vapāyāmiti mantre śrutasyāpi puṃstvasyānārabhyādhītenāpi pratyakṣavidhivihitena strītvenāvarodhena vidhikalpanānupapatteḥ chāndasatayā
analyzed: chāgasya vapāyām iti mantre śrutasya api puṃstvasya an ārabhya adhītena api pratyakṣa vidhi vihitena strītvena avarodhena vidhi kalpanā anupapatteḥ chāndasa tayā
translated: Even though the masculine gender is heard in the mantra of the testicles of the goat, it is not possible to assume an injunction by the feminine gender enjoined by the directly stated injunction not connected with anything else, because it can be explained away as being in the Vedic language.

analyzed: parihartum śakya tvāt
translated: Because it can be explained away as being in the Vedic language.

analyzed: kṛṣṇasāraṅga ādi vidheḥ api citra tva āśraya tayā pakṣa prāpta kṛṣṇasāraṅga ādi rūpa niyama artha tayā api upapanna tvena avirodha īpapatteḥ ca
translated: And because the injunction of the black antelope, etc. is also possible without contradiction, as serving the purpose of restricting the form of the black antelope, etc. which is a party to the case, by being the basis of the variegated nature.

analyzed: atas yukte agnīṣomīye tayoḥ niveśaḥ
translated: Therefore, it is proper that they are included in the Agnisomiya.

original: evaṃ tāvatprācāṃ rītyāgnīṣomīyapaśuyāgamātre niveśa iti pūrvapakṣamupapādyādhunā svātantryeṇa pakṣāntaramāha sarvapaśuyāgeti //
analyzed: evam tāvat prācām rītyā agnīṣomīya paśu yāga mātre niveśaḥ iti pūrvapakṣam upapādya adhunā svātantryeṇa pakṣa antaram āha sarva paśu yāga iti
translated: Thus, having explained the prima facie view that they are to be included only in the Agnisomiya animal sacrifice according to the method of the ancient teachers, he now states another view independently, saying in all animal sacrifices.

original: dviruktatvādyabhāvanirūpaṇapūrvakaṃ citratvastrītvayoḥ sarvapaśusaṃbandhanirūpaṇam🔽ayaṃ bhāvāḥ yathaivahi āśrāvayetyādisaptadaśākṣarāṇāṃ prajāpatisaṃjñānā 'meṣa
analyzed: dvirukta tva ādi abhāva nirūpaṇa pūrvakam citra tva strī tvayoḥ sarva paśu saṃbandha nirūpaṇam  ayam bhāvāḥ yathā eva hi āśrāvaya ityādi saptadaśa akṣarāṇām prajāpati saṃjñānāḥ
translated: The description of the connection of variegation and femininity with all animal sacrifices, preceded by the description of the absence of repetition, etc.🔽This is the view: Just as the seventeen syllables beginning with āśrāvaya which are called Prajāpati

original: vai saptadaśaḥ prajāpatiryajñamanvāyatta' mitividhinā sākṣādyajñamātroddeśena vidhāne
analyzed: vai saptadaśaḥ prajāpatiḥ yajñam anvāyatta miti vidhinā sākṣāt yajña mātra uddeśena vidhāne
translated: are directly enjoined with reference to the sacrifice alone by the injunction This is indeed the seventeenfold Prajāpati dependent on the sacrifice,

analyzed: pi na prakṛtau eva niveśaḥ
translated: Nor is it to be included only in the archetype.

analyzed: atideśāt pūrvam upadeśa pravṛttau atideśa kalpanasya eva abhāvena dvis ukta tva abhāvāt
translated: Because before the extension, when the teaching is in operation, there is no assumption of extension itself, so there is no repetition.

original: ata eva parṇatādau juhūddeśena vidhāne sati tatprāptyarthamatideśāpekṣaṇāttataḥ pūrvaṃ pravṛttyabhāvena prāptikālavaiṣamyāt dviruktatvopapattiriti
analyzed: atas eva parṇa tā ādau juhū uddeśena vidhāne sati tad prāpti artham atideśa apekṣaṇāt tatas pūrvam pravṛtti abhāvena prāpti kāla vaiṣamyāt dvis ukta tva upapattiḥ iti
translated: For this very reason, when the injunction is with reference to the ladle, in the case of the leaf etc., because the extension is required for obtaining that, there is no operation before that, so the inequality of the time of obtaining is established, and the repetition is justified.

analyzed: vaiṣamyam
translated: Thus there is inequality.

original: tathaivehāpi sākṣādyāgamātroddeśena citratvastrītvayorvidhāne dviruktatvābhāvātprakṛtisādhāraṇyena prāṇidravyakayāgamātroddeśena nāyuktaṃ tadvidhānam
analyzed: tathā eva iha api sākṣāt yāga mātra uddeśena citra tva strī tvayoḥ vidhāne dvirukta tva abhāvāt prakṛti sādhāraṇyena prāṇi dravyaka yāga mātra uddeśena na ayuktam tad vidhānam
translated: In the same way, here also, when the variegatedness and femininity are enjoined directly with reference to the sacrifice alone, there is no repetition. So it is not improper to enjoin them with reference to the sacrifice alone, which has an animal substance, in a manner common to the archetype.

analyzed: atas eva sarva paśu yāgeṣu paśoḥ upadiṣṭa tvāt na atra paśu rūpa dvāra saṃbandha artham api atideśa apekṣā
translated: For this very reason, since the animal is taught in all animal sacrifices, there is no need for extension even for the connection with the door in the form of the animal here.
Or the determination of the variegatedness and femininity as having a scope other than the animal for Vayu, after refuting the view expressed in the Kautsa-bhasya.

original: evaṃ sthite yatra vāyavyaṃśveta mityādau paśorapyatideśastatra dviruktatvaprasaṅgāttatsādhāraṇyenaitadvidhānāsaṃbhave
analyzed: evam sthite yatra vāyavyaṃśu etam ityādau paśoḥ api atideśaḥ tatra dvis ukta tva prasaṅgāt tad sādhāraṇyena etad vidhāna asaṃbhave
translated: When this is the case, where there is extension even to the animal in the case of the Vāyavya white one, etc., because of the contingency of repetition, even though it is impossible to enjoin this by way of their commonality,

analyzed: pi yatra ā āgneyam savanīyam paśum upākaroti ityādau dravya devatā saṃbandha vyatirekeṇa
translated: where in the case of the Āgneya Savanīya animal, etc., because of the non-establishment of the sacrifice except for the connection with the substance and deity,

analyzed: yāgasya eva asiddhyā dravya upadeśa avaśyaṃbhāvaḥ
translated: the instruction of the substance is necessarily present.

analyzed: tatra prāpti kāla vaiṣamya bhāvāt tādṛśa vikṛti sādhāraṇyena etat vidhānam na anupapannam iti yat pūjya pādaiḥ kaustubhe uktam
translated: There, because there is no difference in the time of obtaining, the injunction of this by way of commonality with such a modification is not impossible, as stated by the revered Pādas in the Kautsa.

original: tadvāyavyavākye 'pi dravyadevatāsaṃbandhavyatirekeṇa yāgāsiddhestulyatvena tatrāpi🔽śvetadravyasāmānyasaṃbandhenaiva yāgasya kalpanānurodhena śvetasyaiva prathamato
analyzed: tat vāyavya vākye pi dravya devatā saṃbandha vyatirekeṇa yāga asiddheḥ tulya tvena tatra api  śveta dravya sāmānya saṃbandhena eva yāgasya kalpanā anurodhena śvetasya eva
translated: Even in the case of the Vāyavya statement, because of the non-establishment of the sacrifice except for the connection with the substance and deity, it is the same. Even there,🔽in accordance with the necessity of imagining the sacrifice only in connection with the general substance white, the connection of the white one itself as the substance must be stated first.

analyzed: dravya tvena anvayasya avaśya vaktavya tvāt atideśa pravṛtteḥ pūrvam eva upadeśena citra tva strī tvayoḥ tad paricchedaka tvena anvaya upapatteḥ
translated: Because of the possibility of the connection of the variegated and feminine as its delimiters by the instruction itself before the commencement of the extension,

original: kiṃ taccitrastrīrūpaṃ śvetaṃ dravyamiti viśeṣākāṅkṣayaiva paśvatideśakalpanātsamānamiti
analyzed: kim tat citra strī rūpam śvetam dravyam iti viśeṣa ākāṅkṣayā eva paśu atideśa kalpanāt samānam iti
translated: What is that white substance in the form of a variegated cow? The need for specification itself leads to the assumption of a different place for the cow. So it is the same.

analyzed: katham iva yuktam iti cintyam
translated: How is it proper? This is to be thought about.

original: ato vāyavyavākye śvetamityutpattiśiṣṭaśvetaguṇapuṃstvānurodhādeva citratvastrītvayorniveśo na saṃbhavatītyeva samādheyam //
analyzed: atas vāyavya vākye śvetam iti utpatti śiṣṭa śveta guṇa puṃstva anurodhāt eva citra tva strī tvayoḥ niveśaḥ na saṃbhavati iti eva samādheyam
translated: Therefore, in the sentence about the offering to Vayu, the inclusion of variegation and femininity can be explained only by the fact that the white color and masculinity prescribed in the original cannot be included. This alone should be accepted as the answer.

analyzed: virodhi an ākrānta sarva vikṛti paśu yāgeṣu citra tva strī tvayoḥ niveśa upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: The inclusion of variegation and femininity in all modified animal sacrifices that are not overridden by contradictions.

original: evaṃ caitādṛśavirodhyantaraṃ yasyāṃ vikṛtau tatra niveśāsaṃbhave 'pi yasyāṃ na tat tādṛśasarvapaśudravyakayāgamātroddeśena tadvidhānamiti dvitīyapakṣaniṣkarṣaḥ
analyzed: evam ca etādṛśa virodhi antaram yasyām vikṛtau tatra niveśa asaṃbhave yasyām na tat tādṛśa sarva paśu dravyaka yāga mātra uddeśena tad vidhānam iti dvitīya pakṣa niṣkarṣaḥ
translated: And thus, in a modification where there is such a contradiction, even if the inclusion is not possible, in one where the injunction is not for all animal substances and sacrifices, the second conclusion is drawn.

analyzed: na ca kḷpta upakāra atideśa prāpta pāñcadaśya avarodhena an ārabhya adhīta sāptadaśyasya sarva vikṛtiṣu niveśa asaṃbhava vat iha api kḷpta upakāra kṛṣṇasāraṅga avarodhe
translated: And it cannot be said that just as the injunction of seventeen in the Anuvada section cannot be included in all modifications due to the obstruction of the fifteen obtained through the extension of what is useful, similarly here also, due to the obstruction of the useful black antelope,

analyzed: katham tayoḥ niveśaḥ
translated: how can those two be included?

analyzed: iti vācyam pūrvokta rītyā virodha abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction as explained before.

analyzed: prakaraṇa anadhītasya śara ādeḥ kḷpta upakāra atideśika bādhaka tva vat anārabhya adhītasya api ānarthakya pratihata nyāyena ātideśika bādhaka tva upapatteḥ ca
translated: And because it is possible for what is enjoined in a different context, like the arrow etc., to be overridden by what is established as helpful, even what is enjoined in a different section can be overridden by the principle of avoiding meaninglessness.

original: anyathā ya iṣṭyetivākyāvagatasya sadyaḥ kālatvasyāpi prākṛtatryahakālatvāvarodhādvikṛtiṣu niveśānāpatteḥ //
analyzed: anyathā yaḥ iṣṭyā iti vākya avagatasya sadyas kāla tvasya api prākṛta tri aha kāla tva avarodhāt vikṛtiṣu niveśa anāpatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, even the immediacy understood from the sentence who desires heaven would be restricted by the three-day period of the original, and so could not be applied to the modifications.

analyzed: atas yuktam vikṛtau api tad vidhānam
translated: Therefore, it is proper to enjoin it in the modification also.
Doubt about enjoining the variegatedness and femininity in the ewe sacrifice, the refutation of that by Somaprabha, its criticism etc.

analyzed: sarva paśu yāgeṣu tad vidhāne vākya bheda abhāva nirūpaṇam
translated: Even if it is enjoined in all animal sacrifices, the absence of split-of-the-sentence is determined.

analyzed: nanu yāga anuvādena ubhaya guṇa vidhāne vidhi āvṛtti lakṣaṇa vākya bheda āpattiḥ
translated: If the two qualities are enjoined by way of a restatement of the sacrifice, there is the undesirable consequence of split-of-the-sentence in the form of repetition of injunction.

analyzed: atas yatra meṣī yāge strī tvam prāptam
translated: Therefore, where femininity is obtained in the ewe sacrifice,

original: tatraiva citratvamātravidhānena tadaprasaktestadvikṛtimātra eva niveśāpattyā nāgnīṣomīye sarvapaśuyāge vā niveśapūrvapakṣo yuktaḥ /
analyzed: tatra eva citra tva mātra vidhānena tad aprasakteḥ tad vikṛti mātre eva niveśa āpattyā na agnīṣomīye sarva paśu yāge vā niveśa pūrvapakṣaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: there, by enjoining only the variegatedness, it is not applicable. Therefore, the prima facie view that it is to be applied only in that modification and not in the agnisomiya or in all animal sacrifices is not proper.

analyzed: yat tu atra strī tva prāptyā meṣī yāga rūpa vikṛtau tad vidhānam
translated: But here, in the modification in the form of the ewe's sacrifice due to the attainment of femininity, that is enjoined.

original: athavā adityai trayo rohitaitā iti vākyavihitavikṛtau citratvaprāptyā strītvasya vidhānamiti vinigamanāvirahāpādanaṃ somanāthadīkṣitasya /
analyzed: athavā adityai trayaḥ rohita etāḥ iti vākya vihita vikṛtau citra tva prāptyā strī tvasya vidhānam iti vinigamana a viraha āpādanam somanātha dīkṣitasya
translated: Or, in the modifications enjoined by the sentence Three red ones for Aditi, the injunction of femininity due to the attainment of variegatedness - this is the argument for the absence of determination by Somanatha Diksita.

analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: That is incorrect.

analyzed: aditiyāge utpatti śiṣṭa puṃstva avarodhe tad niveśa asaṃbhavasya eva niyāmaka tvāt
translated: Because the impossibility of inserting that in the case of Aditi's sacrifice, when the masculinity prescribed by the originative injunction is obstructed, is itself the determining factor.

original: ataḥ kathamagnīṣomīye sarvapaśuyāge vā citratvastrītvaviśiṣṭakaraṇatvasyaikasyaivaikapadopāttasya vidhāne vidhyāvṛtteraprasakteravākyabhedaḥ /🔽yadyapi kārakasyāpyutpattivākyādeva prāptatvāttadviśiṣṭavidhyasaṃbhave tadanuvādenobhayavidhāne vākyabhedatādavasthyam /
analyzed: atas katham agnīṣomīye sarva paśu yāge vā citra tva strī tva viśiṣṭa karaṇatvasya ekasya eva eka pada upāttasya vidhāne vidhi āvṛtteḥ aprasakteḥ avākya bhedaḥ  yadi api kārakasya api utpatti vākyāt eva prāptatvāt tad viśiṣṭa vidhi asaṃbhave tad anuvādena ubhaya vidhāne vākya bheda tādavasthyam
translated: Therefore, how can there be no syntactical split in the injunction of only one qualified by variegatedness and femininity in the Agnisomiya sacrifice or in all animal sacrifices, since the repetition of injunction is not applicable?🔽Even though the instrument is also obtained from the originative injunction itself, and in the impossibility of enjoining that which is qualified by it, or in the restatement of that and the injunction of both, the syntactical split remains.

analyzed: tathā api tatra dravya āśritāyāḥ tasyāḥ prāptatve pi citra tva strī tva niṣṭha karaṇatayoḥ aprāptatvena vidhi upapattiḥ
translated: However, even though there the instrument based on the substance is obtained, the instrument consisting of variegatedness and femininity is not obtained, so the injunction is possible.

original: dravyaguṇādīnāṃ vyāpārabhedena svarūpasaṃbandhaviśeṣarūpāṇāṃ śaktirūpapadārthāntararūpāṇāṃ vā karaṇatānāṃ bhedasyāvaśyakatvāt /
analyzed: dravya guṇa ādīnām vyāpāra bhedena svarūpa saṃbandha viśeṣa rūpāṇām śakti rūpa padārtha antara rūpāṇām vā karaṇatānām bhedasya āvaśyaka tvāt
translated: Because it is necessary to distinguish the instrumentalities, which are of the nature of the particular relations of the substance, quality, etc., with their own forms, in the form of potencies or in the form of other categories, according to the difference in their operations.

original: ata eva anekāsāmapi karaṇatānāṃ ekayā tṛtīyayopādānena yugapadupasthiterna vākyabheda iti bhāvaḥ //
analyzed: atas eva anekāsām api karaṇatānām ekayā tṛtīyayā upādānena yugapad upasthiteḥ na vākya bhedaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And for this very reason, there is no split of the sentence even when many instrumentalities are presented simultaneously by the mention of one third case, this is the idea.

analyzed: prakṛtau strī tva mātra vidhānam iti somānātha mata khaṇḍana pūrvakam prācīna mata vyavasthāpanam
translated: Refutation of the view of Somānātha that in the archetype only femininity is enjoined, followed by the establishment of the ancient view.

original: yattu atra kṛṣṇasāraṅgatvādinā prakṛtau citratvasya prāptatvāt strītvamātravidhānenāpi vākyabhedaparihārasaṃbhavopapādanaṃ somanāthasya /
analyzed: yat tu atra kṛṣṇa sāraṅga tva ādinā prakṛtau citra tvasya prāpta tvāt strī tva mātra vidhānena api vākya bheda parihāra saṃbhava upapādanam somanāthasya
translated: As for the argument of Somānātha that since variegation is obtained in the archetype by the Kṛṣṇasāraṅga nature, the sentence can be avoided even by enjoining only femininity,

analyzed: tat citra tva vidhi abhāve kṛṣṇa sāraṅga tva ādi vidheḥ anapekṣita apūrva vidhi tva āpatteḥ tad apekṣayā ukta prakāreṇa
translated: that is because, in the absence of an injunction of variegation, the injunction of Kṛṣṇasāraṅga nature would become an independent injunction of an unseen act, and in dependence on that,

analyzed: vākya bheda parihāreṇa citra tvasya api vidhim aṅgīkṛtya kṛṣṇasāraṅga vidheḥ apekṣita niyama vidhi tva svīkārasya eva
translated: by avoiding the split of the sentence in the manner stated, accepting even the injunction of variegation, and accepting the injunction of Kṛṣṇasāraṅga nature as an injunction of a required rule,

analyzed: yukta tvena tatas citra tva prāpti upapādanena vākya bheda parihāra saṃbhava kathanasya ayukta tvāt upekṣyam
translated: Or, by showing the possibility of avoiding split-of-the-sentence by establishing the attainment of variety from that by connection.

original: ato viśiṣṭakārakavidhyaṅgīkāreṇa prācāmabhimata eva tatparihāro yuktaḥ //
analyzed: atas viśiṣṭa kāraka vidhi aṅgīkāreṇa prācām abhimataḥ eva tad parihāraḥ yuktaḥ
translated: Therefore, it is proper to accept the avoidance of that as desired by the ancients itself by accepting the injunction of a qualified action.

Even according to the ancient view, by showing the connection with the result also, the conclusion that the word citra refers to a quality is to be made after avoiding the doubt of split-of-the-sentence.

original: naca evaṃ phalasaṃbandhasyāpi yāge vidhānādviruddhatrikadvayāpattirvākyabhedo vā duṣpariharaḥ iti vācyam /
analyzed: naca evam phala saṃbandhasya api yāge vidhānāt viruddha trika dvaya āpattiḥ vākya bhedaḥ vā duṣpariharaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that in this way, because the connection with the result is enjoined in the sacrifice also, the occurrence of two contradictory sets of three or the split-of-the-sentence is difficult to avoid.
Because the word paśukāma is not to be enjoined as merely restating the desire to acquire cattle which is the means, it is not relevant.

original: atra ca meṣīyāge vā prakṛte dhānāyāge vā citratvavidhānamiti prakārāntareṇa pūrvapakṣakaraṇaṃ kaustubhe draṣṭavyam //
analyzed: atra ca meṣī yāge vā prakṛte dhānā yāge vā citra tva vidhānam iti prakāra antareṇa pūrvapakṣa karaṇam kaustubhe draṣṭavyam
translated: And here, in the Kautsa, it should be seen that the method of presenting the prima facie view in a different way, that the injunction of variety is either in the sacrifice of a ewe or in the sacrifice of barley, which is the subject matter.

analyzed: evam citrā padasya guṇa vidhi paratvam upapādya ājya ādi padānām tad paratvam upapādayati evam iti
translated: Having thus established that the word citra refers to an injunction of a quality, he establishes that the words ājya etc. refer to that [in the next verse].

analyzed: ājya pṛṣṭha vākyayoḥ pūrvapakṣa anuguṇa vākya artha anuṣṭhānayoḥ nirūpaṇam
translated: The determination of the meaning of the sentences having ghee as the back and having the back in accordance with the prima facie view.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ ājya pṛṣṭha vākyayoḥ astiḥ bhavantī paraḥ prathama puruṣaḥ pi a prayujyamānaḥ  iti anuśāsanena abhyanujñātasya asi dhātoḥ prathama puruṣa bahuvacana antasya adhyāhārāt tasya
translated: This is the meaning: In the sentences having ghee as the back and having the back, although the first person ending is not used,🔽it is present by the injunction is, and by the insertion of the first person plural ending of the verb as, which is permitted by the rule.

analyzed: ca aprāpta tvena vidhi kalpanayā pañcadaśa saṅkhyā viśiṣṭa ājya sattā prakaraṇāt stotra aṅga tayā vidhīyate
translated: And because that is not obtained, the existence of ghee qualified by the number fifteen is enjoined as a part of the stotra by the rule of injunction, from the context.

original: yadyapi svavyāpāre vidhinā puruṣo niyujyata iti nyāyādvidhiḥ puruṣavyāpārarūpāṃ bhāvanāmākṣipati /
analyzed: yadi api sva vyāpāre vidhinā puruṣaḥ niyujyate iti nyāyāt vidhiḥ puruṣa vyāpāra rūpām bhāvanām ākṣipati
translated: Although by the principle that a person is employed in his own operation by the injunction, the injunction implies the bhāvanā, which is the operation of the person.

analyzed: tasyāḥ ca niravacchinnāyāḥ vyāpāra tva ayogāt avacchedaka artha apekṣāyām sattāyāḥ prayojya niṣṭhatvena puruṣa vyāpāra tva abhāvāt avacchedaka tva anupapattiḥ
translated: And because that unrestricted operation is not possible, and there is a need for the meaning of restriction, since existence does not have the nature of being the operation of a person by being based on the employed, it cannot be the restrictor.

original: tathāpi avāntaraprakaraṇāvagatastotrāṅgatvabalena pradhānadeśasthatvāvagateḥ tasya ca samīpasthāpanasaṃpādyatvena sthāpanākhyadhātvarthasyaiva
analyzed: tathā api avāntara prakaraṇa avagata stotra aṅga tva balena pradhāna deśa stha tva avagateḥ tasya ca samīpa sthāpana saṃpādya tvena sthāpana ākhya dhātvarthasya eva
translated: Still, due to the strength of being subsidiary to the stotra understood from the internal context, the fact that it is located in the place of the primary is understood. And since that is accomplished by the establishment of what is nearby, the meaning of the verbal root sthāpana (to establish) itself

original: tadavacchedakatvaṃ kalpyate /🔽ataścāsmin agnimupadhāya stuvītetivat sthāpanasaṃpādyasattādvāreṇājyādīnāṃ stotropakārakatā pṛṣṭhavidhayā na virudhyate /
analyzed: kalpyate  atas ca asmin agnim upadhāya stuvīta iti vat sthāpana saṃpādya sattā dvāreṇa ājya ādīnām stotra upakāraka tā pṛṣṭha vidhayā na virudhyate
translated: is imagined to be its qualifier.

analyzed: sāṃsiddhika dravya tvāt ca ājya ādīnām svarūpeṇa saṃkhyā anvaya anupapattyā tāvat saṅkhyāka amatra bhedasya ākṣepāt pañcadaśasu amatreṣu ghṛtāni stotra anuṣṭhāna kāle
translated: And therefore, just as in having placed the fire, one should praise, the help to the stotra by the ajya etc. through the existence accomplished by establishment is not contradicted by the injunction of the prishtha. And because the ajya etc. have inherent substantiality, the number of them is not logically possible in their own form, so the difference of that much number is implied. Therefore, at the time of performing the stotra, the ghee should be established in the fifteen portions.

analyzed: sthāpanīyāni iti anuṣṭhānam  evam parāc mukha saptadaśa prāṇi sthāpanena pṛṣṭha stotram saṃpādya stotavyam iti
translated: This is the performance.🔽Thus, having accomplished the prishtha stotra by establishing the seventeen animals facing away, it should be praised.

analyzed: pañcadaśa ājya vidhāne stome ḍa vidhi virodha upapādanam
translated: The explanation of the contradiction between the injunction of the stoma and the injunction of the number fifteen in the injunction of fifteen portions of ghee.

original: naca stome ḍa vidhiḥ pañcadaśādyarthe ityanuśāsanaśiṣṭaḍapratyayāntapañcadaśādiśabdānāṃ stotrīyarka saṅkhyākṛtastutisaṅkhyāvācitvam /
analyzed: na ca stome ḍa vidhiḥ pañcadaśa ādi arthe iti anuśāsana śiṣṭa ḍa pratyaya anta pañcadaśa ādi śabdānām stotrīya ṛka saṅkhyā kṛta stuti saṅkhyā vāci tvam
translated: And the word 'stoma' is not an injunction in the sense of the fifteen etc., so the words 'pañcadaśa' etc. ending in the suffix 'ḍa' taught by the rule are not denotative of the number of praises in the Stotriya.

analyzed: ṛcaḥ pi tatra praveśe prayojana abhāvena ājya ādi gata tvena api saṅkhyā vidhāna upapatteḥ
translated: Even if the Ṛc verses are included there, the number could be enjoined as being in the Ajya etc., because there is no purpose in the number being in the Stotriya.

original: yadi tu paśvekatvādhikaraṇapūrvapakṣanyāyena saṅkhyāviśiṣṭadravyavidhāne saṅkhyāyā avivakṣāpattirāśaṅkyeta /
analyzed: yadi tu paśu ekatva adhikaraṇa pūrvapakṣa nyāyena saṅkhyā viśiṣṭa dravya vidhāne saṅkhyāyāḥ avivakṣā āpattiḥ āśaṅkyeta
translated: But if, by the reasoning of the prima facie view in the section on the oneness of the animal, the injunction of a substance qualified by number were suspected to lead to the non-mention of the number,

analyzed: tadā kaustubha ukta rītyā saṅkhyā dravya ubhaya viśiṣṭa sthāpana bhāvanāyāḥ eva stotra uddeśena vidhānam astu iti
translated: then, following the explanation in the Kautubha, let there be an injunction of the very establishment-bhāvanā qualified by both the number and the substance, with reference to the Stotra.

analyzed: evam iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: trivṛt bahiṣpavamāna śabdayoḥ traiguṇya vāyu ādi paratva khaṇḍana pūrvakam pavana kriyā viśiṣṭa dravya vāci tva vyavasthāpanam
translated: The establishment of the meaning of the words 'trivṛt' and 'bahiṣpavamāna' as denoting a substance qualified by the action of blowing, after refuting their meaning as referring to the three qualities, wind etc.

original: atra prakāśakāraiḥ pavamānaśabdo yaugiko viśeṣyāpekṣaḥ san prakaraṇāt somenaiva viśeṣyeṇa saṃbadhyate /
analyzed: atra prakāśa kāraiḥ pavamāna śabdaḥ yaugikaḥ viśeṣya apekṣaḥ san prakaraṇāt somena eva viśeṣyeṇa saṃbadhyate
translated: Here, the Prākāśa authors say that the word 'pavamāna' is etymological and requires a qualifier, and is connected by context only with the qualifier 'soma'.

analyzed: trivṛt śabdaḥ tu tṛca traya anukramaṇāt stotrīya anavaka vāci tvena trivṛt caru aśvavāla adhikaraṇe
translated: The word 'trivṛt' is established in the section on 'trivṛt, śarva, vāla' as denoting a group of three stotriya verses, due to the enumeration of three verses.

analyzed: sthāpitaḥ u pi pavamāna śabda sāmānādhikaraṇyāt atra stotrīya anavaka vāci tva tyāgena trivṛt rajjuḥ ityādau
translated: But due to the co-reference with the word 'pavamāna', here it is taken as denoting a group of three, abandoning the meaning of a group of three stotriya verses, like in 'trivṛt rajju' etc.

analyzed: traiguṇye pi prayogāt avayava yogena traiguṇya arthaka tvasya api avagateḥ iha traiguṇya paraḥ
translated: And since the meaning of 'trivṛt' as denoting three is understood from the connection with the parts, even though it is used in the sense of three, here it refers to three.

analyzed: traiguṇyam ca prakaraṇāt daśa muṣṭi parimāṇa soma parimāṇa apekṣayā iti sadasaḥ bahis pavamāna kriyā viśiṣṭa triguṇa saṅkhyā yukta soma dravyasya eva
translated: And the three is in relation to the quantity of Soma measured in ten handfuls, according to the context. Thus, outside the sacrificial hall, the Soma substance with the number three qualified by the action of Pavamāna is enjoined,

analyzed: pūrvavat vidhānam iti uktam tat nirasitum tri bhiṇḍi dravyam iti uktam
translated: as before. To refute that, 'with three Bhinḍis of substance' is said.

analyzed: tasya ayam arthaḥ rūḍhyā tri bhiṇḍi apara paryāya latā vacana tva saṃbhave yaugika artha grahaṇe pramāṇa abhāvaḥ
translated: This is the meaning: When it is possible for the word 'trivṛt' to denote a creeper, a synonym of three Bhinḍis, due to conventional meaning, there is no evidence for taking the etymological meaning.

analyzed: atas eva yatra rūḍhi bādhaḥ tatra eva avayava artha grahaṇam
translated: For this very reason, where there is contradiction with conventional meaning, there alone is the taking of the meaning of the parts.

analyzed: trivṛt rajjuḥ ityādau rajju sāmānādhikaraṇyasya yadi api yogena eva upapatteḥ na rūḍhi kalpanam
translated: In the case of expressions like the rope of three strands, although the co-reference of rope is possible only through secondary meaning, and not by primary denotation,

analyzed: tathā api iha sāpekṣa artha grahaṇa apekṣayā nirapekṣa artha grahaṇam eva uktam
translated: still, here, the grasping of the meaning that requires dependence is said to be less dependent than the grasping of the meaning that does not require dependence.

original: pavamānaśabdasya viśeṣyāpekṣāyāṃ svavākyopāttaviśeṣyalābhe saṃbhavati prākaraṇikaviśeṣyakalpanamayuktaṃ ca /
analyzed: pavamāna śabdasya viśeṣya apekṣāyām sva vākya upātta viśeṣya lābhe saṃbhavati prākaraṇika viśeṣya kalpanam ayuktam ca
translated: When the word Pavamana requires a qualifier, it is not proper to assume a qualifier that is in the context, when a qualifier that is mentioned in the same sentence is available.

original: etena trivṛcchabdapavamānaśabdayoḥ traiguṇyavāyuparatvamaṅgīkṛtya vyajanādinā sadaso bahirvāyuḥ kārya iti pūrvapakṣe 'nuṣṭhānamiti somanāthopanyastaṃ 🔽matāntaramapi nirastam /
analyzed: etena trivṛt śabda pavamāna śabdayoḥ traiguṇya vāyu para tvam aṅgīkṛtya vyajana ādinā sadasaḥ bahis vāyuḥ kāryaḥ iti pūrvapakṣe nuṣṭhānam iti somanātha upanyastam  mata antaram api nirastam
translated: By this, the view proposed by Somnath, that in the prima facie view that the words trivrit and Pavamana refer to the three-stranded substance and the wind, and that the wind outside the sacrificial hall is to be used with fans etc., is also refuted.

original: ato nyāyasudhākṛduktarītyā tribhiṇḍidravyameva pavanakriyāviśiṣṭaṃ vidhīyata ityeva yuktamiti //
analyzed: atas nyāyasudhākṛt ukta rītyā tribhiṇḍi dravyam eva pavana kriyā viśiṣṭam vidhīyate iti eva yuktam iti
translated: Therefore, it is proper to hold that only the three-stranded substance qualified by the action of fanning is enjoined, as stated by the author of the Nyayasudha.

analyzed: pūrvapakṣe lāghavam darśayati
translated: Even in the prima facie view, he shows the simplicity by saying but mere praise.

analyzed: ājyaiḥ stuvate ityādau ājya ādi pada sārthakya ādinā pūrvapakṣa upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: In the case of statements like they praise with the clarified butter, the prima facie view is concluded by the meaningfulness of words like clarified butter etc.

original: ājyapadaṃ tu ekastotrasaṃbandhitvenājyamantrayoḥ parasparasaṃbandhāvagamāt svasaṃbandhitayā lakṣitamantragatakaraṇasyānuvādamātramiti bhāvaḥ
analyzed: ājya padam tu eka stotra saṃbandhi tvena ājya mantrayoḥ paraspara saṃbandha avagamāt sva saṃbandhi tayā lakṣita mantra gata karaṇasya anuvāda mātram iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But in the case of the word ājya (ghee), it is understood that the ājya mantras are mutually related as being connected with the same stotra (hymn). Therefore, the instrument mentioned in the mantra qualified by its own connection is merely a restatement. This is the idea.

original: yadyapi saṃkhyāyuktavākye viśiṣṭavidhikṛtagauravamadhikamasti /🔽tathāpi rūḍhyanurodhena somādivākye lakṣaṇāpādakaviśiṣṭavidherapyaṅgīkāre tadanāpādakaviśiṣṭavidheraṅgīkaraṇaṃ nāyuktamiti bhāvaḥ //
analyzed: yadi api saṃkhyā yukta vākye viśiṣṭa vidhi kṛta gauravam adhikam asti  tathā api rūḍhi anurodhena soma ādi vākye lakṣaṇa āpādaka viśiṣṭa vidheḥ api aṅgīkāre tad anāpādaka viśiṣṭa vidheḥ aṅgīkaraṇam na ayuktam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Although in a sentence with number, there is more weight due to the injunction of a qualified (action),🔽nevertheless, in order to conform to the conventional meaning, it is not improper to accept the injunction of a qualified (action) that does not require the assumption of a secondary meaning in a sentence about Soma, etc. This is the idea.

original: agnīṣomīyādau vākyabhedāpattyā puṃstvāvarodhena punaḥ strītvavidhānāyogācca citratvastrītvavidhānāsaṃbhavādinā siddhāntopapādanam
analyzed: agnīṣomīya ādau vākya bheda āpattyā puṃstva avarodhena punar strītva vidhāna ayogāt ca citra tva strītva vidhāna asaṃbhava ādinā siddhānta upapādanam
translated: And because in Agniṣomīya, etc., there would be a split of the sentence, and because of the restriction of masculinity, the re-instatement of femininity is not possible, and because the injunction of variegatedness and femininity is not possible, the conclusion is established in this way.

original: yadyapi tṛtīyopāttaṃ karaṇatvamātraṃ vidhīyate iti śakyate vaktum /
analyzed: yadi api tṛtīya upāttam karaṇa tva mātram vidhīyate iti śakyate vaktum
translated: Although it can be said that mere instrumentality, which is implied by the third case ending, is enjoined,

original: tathāpi strītvasya yadvyāpāreṇa karaṇatā tadvyāpāreṇaiva puṃstvasya prakṛtau ajo
analyzed: tathā api strī tvasya yad vyāpāreṇa karaṇa tā tad vyāpāreṇa eva puṃstvasya prakṛtau
translated: nevertheless, by the operation of which the femininity is an instrument, by that very operation, the masculinity is in the archetype, the goat.

analyzed: gnīṣomīyaḥ ityādi vacana avagata puṃstva vidhi balāt eva tad karaṇa tvasya prāpta tvāt citrayā iti atra ekayā eva
translated: Because the instrumentality is obtained by the force of the injunction of masculinity understood from the statement beginning with agnisomiya, the singular in citrayā is for the purpose of indicating the number.

original: tṛtīyayā karaṇatvamanūdya pratyayāṃśena strītvavidhiḥ /🔽prātipadikāṃśayuktayā ca tayā citratvaviśiṣṭakaraṇatvavidhiriti vidheyānāmekābhidhānapratipādyatvābhāvāt
analyzed: tṛtīyayā karaṇa tvam anūdya pratyaya aṃśena strī tva vidhiḥ  prātipadika aṃśa yuktayā ca tayā citra tva viśiṣṭa karaṇa tva vidhiḥ iti vidheyānām eka abhidhāna pratipādya tva abhāvāt
translated: Because the instrumentality is already obtained by the force of the injunction of masculinity understood from the statement beginning with 'agnisomiya', the instrumentality is recalled by the single third case ending in 'citrayā', and the injunction of femininity is by the suffix part.🔽And by that [third case ending] along with the stem part, there is an injunction of instrumentality qualified by colorfulness. Thus, since the objects of injunction are not to be expressed by a single word,

analyzed: vākya bheda āpattiḥ anivāryā eva iti abhiprāyeṇa pūrvapakṣe vākya bhedam āpādya siddhāntam āha prāptā iti
translated: the inevitable consequence of split-of-the-sentence is the prima facie view. With this intention, having deduced the split-of-the-sentence, he states the conclusion with 'prāpte' (when the instrumentality is already obtained).

analyzed: kathañcid karaṇa bhedaḥ
translated: Or let there be a difference in the instrument somehow.

original: tathāpi prakṛtau puṃstvāvarodhānna strītvavidhisaṃbhava ityāha agnīṣomīya itīti //
analyzed: tathā api prakṛtau puṃstva avarodhāt na strī tva vidhi saṃbhavaḥ iti āha agnīṣomīyaḥ iti iti
translated: Even so, because of the restriction of masculinity in the archetype, the injunction of femininity is not possible. He says 'agnisomiya' etc.

analyzed: pūrvapakṣi upapādita puṃstva prāpaka pramāṇa abhāva nirāsa artham ajaḥ gnīṣomīyaḥ iti śākhāntarīya vākya upanyāsaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: The citation of the statement from a different branch, 'the goat is for Agni and Soma', is done to refute the absence of evidence establishing masculinity as explained by the prima facie view.

analyzed: etat ca paśu kāma pada anupapatti prakṛta dadhi ādi yāga prakaraṇa bādhā āpattyoḥ api upalakṣaṇam
translated: And this is also a reference to the non-applicability of the word 'desiring cattle' and the contradiction of the context of the curd-offering etc. in the archetype.

analyzed: ataeva meṣī yāga dhānā yāgayoḥ api tad vidhānam nirastam
translated: Therefore, the injunctions regarding the sheep sacrifice and the barley sacrifice are also refuted.

analyzed: citrā vākye nāmadheya tvam upasaṃharati atas iti
translated: He concludes that the word 'citra' is a name in the sentence 'citra'
In the word 'citra', the establishment of the meaning of the name by the primary meaning of the word.

analyzed: nāmadheya tva pakṣe svatantra rūḍhi kalpanā āpattim nirasyati vicitra dravyaka tvena iti
translated: In the case of being a name, he rejects the consequence of assuming an independent primary meaning by saying 'by the quality of consisting of various substances'.

analyzed: na asmābhiḥ citrā śabde rūḍhiḥ aṅgīkriyate
translated: We do not accept the primary meaning of the word 'citra'.

analyzed: kintu citra dravyaka tva saṃbandhena vaidika pracura prayogāt darśana ādi padeṣu iva nirūḍha lakṣaṇā iti
translated: But by the connection with the quality of consisting of various substances, it is a primary meaning word like the words 'darśa' etc., due to frequent usage in the Vedas.

original: atra ca na bahudravyatayaiva citradravyakatvaṃ vivakṣitam /
analyzed: atra ca na bahu dravyatayā eva citra dravyaka tvam vivakṣitam
translated: And here, the quality of consisting of various substances is not intended to be merely the quality of consisting of many substances.

analyzed: kintu dvi dravya tayā api
translated: But even by the quality of consisting of two substances.

original: ata eva taittirīyaśākhāyāṃ citrayā yajeta paśukāma iyaṃ vai citre tyupakramya
analyzed: atas eva taittirīya śākhāyām citrayā yajeta paśu kāmaḥ iyam vai citre ti upakramya
translated: For this very reason, in the Taittiriya branch, beginning with 'This is indeed the variegated one',

analyzed: āmnātānām puroḍāśa caru dravyakāṇām āgneya tvāṣṭra ādi sapta yāgānām caru puroḍāśa dravya tā mātreṇa eva
translated: the seven sacrifices beginning with the Āgneya and Āṣṭākapāla, which are mentioned as having the substances of charu and puroḍāśa,
the word 'citra' is established as a name merely by the substance of charu and puroḍāśa.

original: dravyadvayenāpi saṃpratipannadevatākatvābhāvena pṛthagyāgānāmanuṣṭhāne 'pi citradravyakatvopapatteḥ iti bhāvaḥ //
analyzed: dravya dvayena api saṃpratipanna devatāka tva abhāvena pṛthak yāgānām anuṣṭhāne pi citra dravyaka tva upapatteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that even when the sacrifices are performed separately, the property of having variegated substances is possible, as there is no common deity accepted by both substances.

analyzed: strī pratyayaḥ iti
translated: The feminine ending.

analyzed: ekavacanāt tasya api rājasūya padasya iva samudāya abhiprāyeṇa upapatteḥ api etat upalakṣaṇam
translated: Due to the singular number, even that word 'rāj-sūya' is possible with the intention of the whole, so this is also an indication.

original: prāptakarmānuvādena citratvastrītvarūpānekaguṇavidhāne vākyabhedāt karaṇatvasyāpi🔽paśugatasya prāptatvenāvidheyatayobhayaviśiṣṭakārakavidhyayogāt ajo 'gnīṣomīya🔽iti vacanena vihitaprākaraṇikapuṃstvāvarodhena strītvasya vidhyayogācca na guṇavidhiḥ /
analyzed: prāpta karma anuvādena citra tva strī tva rūpa aneka guṇa vidhāne vākya bhedāt karaṇa tvasya api  paśu gatasya prāpta tvena avidheya tayā ubhaya viśiṣṭa kāraka vidhi ayogāt ajaḥ gnīṣomīya  iti vacanena vihita prākaraṇika puṃstva avarodhena strī tvasya vidhi ayogāt ca na guṇa vidhiḥ
translated: Or, when many qualities like variegation and femininity are enjoined by a restatement of the obtained action, there is split of the sentence. Even the instrumentality

original: ataḥ prakṛtānāmeva yāgānāṃ vicitradravyakatvena lakṣaṇayā citrāpadaṃ nāmadheyam /
analyzed: atas prakṛtānām eva yāgānām vicitra dravyaka tvena lakṣaṇayā citrā padam nāmadheyam
translated: is obtained and cannot be enjoined, so it is not possible to enjoin a case ending qualified by both. Therefore, due to having variegated substances, the word 'citra' is a name by indication of the already-mentioned sacrifices.

analyzed: iṣṭi abhiprāyeṇa ca strī pratyayaḥ
translated: And the feminine ending is with the intention of the sacrifice.

original: evamājyādipadeṣvapi asamastatvena viśiṣṭasyāvyutpannatvāt prāptastotrānuvādena dravyasaṅkhyādyanekaguṇavidhau vākyabhedaḥ /
analyzed: evam ājya ādi padeṣu api asamasta tvena viśiṣṭasya avyutpanna tvāt prāpta stotra anuvādena dravya saṅkhyā ādi aneka guṇa vidhau vākya bhedaḥ
translated: Similarly, in the words 'ājya' etc., because the qualified is not well-known as uncompounded, there would be syntactical split in enjoining many qualities like the substance and number by way of a restatement of the stotra, which is obtained.

original: na ca utpattivākya eva dravyaviśiṣṭastotravidhiritaratra tu saṅkhyāmātravidhirastviti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca utpatti vākye eva dravya viśiṣṭa stotra vidhiḥ itaratra tu saṅkhyā mātra vidhiḥ astu iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that in the originative injunction itself there is an injunction of the stotra qualified by the substance, and elsewhere there is only an injunction of the number.

analyzed: ghṛta ādīnām stotre karaṇa tva asaṃbhavena viśiṣṭa vidhi ayogāt
translated: Because, due to the impossibility of ghee etc. being the instrument in the stotra, a qualified injunction is not possible.

analyzed: pañcadaśāni ityādi stuti gata ṛk saṅkhyā rūpa stoma vāci ḍapratyayasya guṇa vidhi tve n upapatteḥ ca
translated: And because of the impossibility of the suffix 'ḍa' denoting the stoma in the form of the number of ṛc verses in the praise beginning with 'paṃcadaśāni', etc., being an injunction of a quality.

analyzed: atas ājya ādi padam vākya dvaye śaktyā eva stotra nāmadheyam
translated: Therefore, the word 'ājya' etc. is the name of the stotra by its own power in both sentences.

analyzed: ājya ādi pada abhidheya stotra anuvādena ca guṇa vākye sarvatra saṅkhyā mātra vidhiḥ
translated: And in the sentence enjoining the quality, the injunction of the number alone is everywhere by way of a restatement of the stotra denoted by the word 'ājya' etc.

analyzed: ājya utpatti vākye ca tad saṃjñakāni catvāri stotrāṇi
