original: virodhe syādi tyadhikaraṇe pañcame āgneyāgnīṣomīyayoḥ brāhmaṇakramaviparyayeṇa mantrakramāmnānasya
analyzed: virodhe ti adhikaraṇe pañcame āgneya agnīṣomīyayoḥ brāhmaṇa krama viparyayeṇa mantra krama āmnānasya
translated: the recitation of the mantras of the Āgneya and Āgneya-Soma sacrifices in the reverse order of the Brāhmaṇa sequence is going to be stated,

original: vakṣyamāṇatvena kramaviniyuktamantrābhāvāt śrutyaviniyuktānāṃ ca mantrāṇāṃ svārthasamavāyakalpakatvābhāvāt
analyzed: vakṣyamāṇa tvena krama viniyukta mantra abhāvāt śruti a viniyuktānām ca mantrāṇām sva artha samavāya kalpaka tva abhāvāt
translated: and since there are no mantras employed by sequence, and since the mantras not employed by Śruti do not have the power to imply the connection with their own meaning,

analyzed: māntravarṇika devatā kalpanā anupapatteḥ dravya devatā saṃyogena api yāgasya kalpayitum aśakya tvāt āgneyam
translated: Because it is not possible to assume a deity based on the letters of the mantra, and because the sacrifice cannot be assumed even by the connection of substance and deity, the offering to Agni

original: caturdhā karotī tyādivyavahārasya ca dravyaviṣayatvena karmanāmānapekṣatvānniṣprayojanatvenāpi
analyzed: caturdhā karoti ityādi vyavahārasya ca dravya viṣaya tvena karma nāma anapekṣa tvāt niṣprayojana tvena api
translated: Because it is not possible to assume a deity based on the words of the mantra, and because it is not possible to imagine the sacrifice even by the connection of substance and deity, the statement He cuts the cake offered to Agni into four parts etc.

original: nāmatvāśaṅkānupapatteḥ na nāmatvacintā yuktā /🔽ataḥ pūrvādhikaraṇe tantrasaṃbandhānupapattyā viśiṣṭavidhau niraste kvacidapi tarhyanāvṛttena
analyzed: nāma tva āśaṅkā anupapatteḥ na nāma tva cintā yuktā  atas pūrva adhikaraṇe tantra saṃbandha anupapattyā viśiṣṭa vidhau niraste kvacid api tarhi anāvṛttena
translated: is about the substance, and since it does not depend on the name of the ritual, the doubt of it being a name due to being purposeless is not possible. Therefore, the consideration of it being a name is not appropriate.🔽Therefore, in the previous section, when the injunction of the qualified is refuted due to the impossibility of the connection with the Tantra, then the doubt arises that the injunction of the qualified is not possible anywhere with the non-repeated suffix.

analyzed: pratyayena viśiṣṭa vidhiḥ na saṃbhavati iti āśaṅkya viśiṣṭa vidhi vyutpādanāya eva etat adhikaraṇam
translated: This section is only for the purpose of explaining the injunction of the qualified.

analyzed: tad vyutpādanasya ca utpatti śiṣṭa guṇa balīyaḥ tva siddhiḥ prayojanam
translated: And the establishment of the strength of the qualities prescribed in the origination is the purpose of that explanation.

analyzed: tasya nāmatā
translated: That is its name.

analyzed: soma viśiṣṭe hi utpanne śuddha anuvāda asaṃbhavāt na khanitra ādiḥ tatra iti udbhid ādeḥ nāma tā sidhyati
translated: For when the qualified Soma is produced, the mere restatement is not possible, so the spade etc. are not there. Thus the namehood of Udbhid etc. is established.

original: śrutena tu pratyayena śuddhaṃ yāgaṃ vidhāyopapadānarthakyaparijihīrṣayā tadarthavidhināyāśrutapratyayāntarakalpane
analyzed: śrutena tu pratyayena śuddham yāgam vidhāya upapada ānarthakya parijihīrṣayā tad artha vidhinā āyā śruta pratyaya antara kalpane
translated: But by the injunction of the pure sacrifice with the understood condition, with the desire to avoid the uselessness of the subsidiary, by the injunction of its meaning, the assumption of another understood condition,

analyzed: śrutasya eva āvṛtti kalpane śuddha yāga anuvādena udbhid somayoḥ vihitayoḥ tulya bala tvena vikalpa upapatteḥ na
translated: by the assumption of the repetition of the very understood [condition], by the restatement of the pure sacrifice, the two enjoined by the udumbara and soma [materials] being of equal strength, the option is possible. Therefore,

original: nāmatā sidhyatīti nāmadheyatvaṃ draḍhayituṃ viśiṣṭavidhiriha vyutpādyate saprayojanaḥ /
analyzed: nāma tā sidhyati iti nāmadheya tvam draḍhayitum viśiṣṭa vidhiḥ iha vyutpādyate sa prayojanaḥ
translated: in order to strengthen the fact that it is a name, the specific injunction is explained here with a purpose.

original: evañca sarvecātra viśiṣṭavidhayaḥ udāharaṇamiti bhāṣyavārtikayorguṇavidhināmadheyacintā pūrvāpavādatvena saṅgatiṃ vaktuṃ kṛtā /
analyzed: evam ca sarve ca atra viśiṣṭa vidhayaḥ udāharaṇam iti bhāṣya vārtikayoḥ guṇa vidhi nāmadheya cintā pūrva apavāda tvena saṅgatim vaktum kṛtā
translated: And thus, all the specific injunctions here are examples. In the Bhāṣya and Vārttika, the consideration of the injunction of a subordinate element and the name is stated to be connected as a later exception.

original: athavā guṇavidhyasaṃbhave sthite vaiyarthyaparihārāya saṃbhavamātreṇa nāmatvamuktam /
analyzed: athavā guṇa vidhi asaṃbhave sthite vaiyarthya parihārāya saṃbhava mātreṇa nāma tvam uktam
translated: Or, when the impossibility of the injunction of a subordinate element is established, the fact that it is a name is stated merely as a possibility for the purpose of avoiding uselessness.
But it is stated that this section is only for the purpose of explaining the specific injunction.

original: tadayukta miti sūcayituṃ yathābhāṣyavārtikaṃ guṇavidhiḥ karmanāmadheyamiti cintāyāṃ niveśitam /
analyzed: tat ayuktam iti sūcayitum yathā bhāṣya vārtikam guṇa vidhiḥ karma nāmadheyam iti cintāyām niveśitam
translated: In order to indicate that this is incorrect, it is included in the consideration of whether it is an injunction of a subordinate element or a name for an action, as stated in the Bhāṣya and Vārttika.

original: ayamāśayaḥ na tāvadatra viśiṣṭavidhivyutpādanaṃ nāmatvavicāre saṅgatam /🔽utpattiśiṣṭaguṇabalīyastvasidhyā viśiṣṭavidhivicārasya saprayojanatve 'pi tadbalīyastvena
analyzed: ayam āśayaḥ na tāvat atra viśiṣṭa vidhi vyutpādanam nāmatva vicāre saṅgatam  utpatti śiṣṭa guṇa balīyaḥ tva sidhyā viśiṣṭa vidhi vicārasya sa prayojana tve pi tad balīyaḥ tvena
translated: The idea is this: First of all, the explanation of the qualified injunction is not relevant in the discussion of the name.🔽Even though the consideration of the qualified injunction is purposeful by establishing the strength of the qualities prescribed in the originative injunction,

analyzed: vājina yāga vat guṇa viśiṣṭa karma antarasya eva udbhid ādi vākyeṣu āpattyā guṇa vidhi tva nirāsa asaṃbhavena
translated: because of its greater strength, only the distinct action qualified by the quality is obtained in the sentences about the udbhid etc., like in the case of the vaji-sacrifice, and the denial of the injunction of the quality is not possible,

analyzed: nāma tā āyāma sādhaka tvāt
translated: because of the lack of proof in the case of the name.

analyzed: yadi vājina vākye rūḍhi balīyaḥ tvena vājina padasya utpatti śiṣṭa guṇa balīyaḥ tvena api na nāma tā iti ucyeta
translated: If it is said that in the sentence about the vaji, the word vaji is not a name even by the strength of the prescribed quality due to the greater strength of convention,

analyzed: tadā udbhida ādi padānām arūḍhatvena tulya vat vṛttika tayā eva nāmatā siddheḥ kim utpatti śiṣṭa guṇa balīyaḥ tvena
translated: then, because the name is established by the same mode of operation as the words udbhid etc. due to their lack of convention, what to speak of the greater strength of the prescribed quality.

original: kiñca viśiṣṭavidhyabhāve 'pi na khanitrasya vikalpaḥ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: kiñca viśiṣṭa vidhi abhāve pi na khanitrasya vikalpaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: Moreover, even in the absence of a qualified injunction, the option of the spade is not possible.

analyzed: udbhid ādi vākyeṣu yāga anuvāda asiddheḥ
translated: Because in the sentences about the udbhid etc., the restatement of the sacrifice is not established.

analyzed: somena yajeta iti vākyasya pūrva pravṛtti āśrayaṇena śuddha yāga vidhāne tadānīm eva upasthita upapada ānarthakya parihārāya
translated: Even though the pure sacrifice is enjoined by the sentence one should sacrifice with soma by relying on the prior occurrence of that, in order to avoid the purposelessness of the immediately present word

original: kalpitenāvṛttena tenaiva vā vidhipratyayena svavākyopasthitayāgānuvādena some vihite
analyzed: kalpitena āvṛttena tena eva vā vidhi pratyayena sva vākya upasthita yāga anuvādena some vihite
translated: When the Soma is enjoined by that very injunction of performance, either imagined or real, by the restatement of the sacrifice present in its own sentence,

original: tenaiva nirākāṅkṣīkṛte yāgenaiva vākyāntaropāttakhanitrādividhānaṃ saṃbhavatīti tatra
analyzed: tena eva nirākāṅkṣīkṛte yāgena eva vākya antara upātta khanitra ādi vidhānam saṃbhavati iti tatra
translated: the injunction of the spade etc. brought in by another sentence is possible only by that very sacrifice which has become desireless.

analyzed: karma antara vidhānasya eva āpattiḥ na tu vikalpaḥ
translated: Therefore, there is only the occurrence of the injunction of a different ritual, not an option.

analyzed: nahi utpatti śiṣṭa guṇa balīyaḥ tve nirākāṅkṣa tā āpādana atiriktam anyat kiñcid karaṇam asti
translated: For when the strength of the qualities prescribed in the origination is paramount, there is nothing else to be done except to produce desirelessness.

original: tattu viśiṣṭavidhyabhāve 'pi sukaramiti /🔽ataeva tatra viśiṣṭavidhiṃ matvarthalakṣaṇāpattyā nirasya yaugikatvādinaiva nāmatvamākare
analyzed: tat tu viśiṣṭa vidhi abhāve pi sukaram iti  ataeva tatra viśiṣṭa vidhim matu artha lakṣaṇa āpattyā nirasya yaugika tva ādinā eva nāma tvam ākare
translated: And that is easy even in the absence of a qualified injunction.🔽For this very reason, in that (case), the qualified injunction is rejected by the assumption of indication of the meaning of the word, and the fact of being a name is established by the fact of having a meaning, etc. in the Akarah.

analyzed: sādhitam iti asaṅgatam viśiṣṭa vidhi vyutpādanam api ca sannikṛṣṭa vidhau asaṃbhava nibandhana tvāt viprakṛṣṭayoḥ viśeṣaṇa viśeṣyayoḥ yugapad vidheya tvasya
translated: Therefore, the explanation of the qualified injunction is irrelevant. Moreover, in the case of a proximate injunction, the fact that the qualifier and the qualified are to be enjoined simultaneously due to the impossibility of the distant ones

analyzed: sannikṛṣṭa vidhāna artham ca tasya asaṃbhavaḥ viprakṛṣṭa vidhāna artham tasya asaṃbhavaḥ ca abhyupagantavyaḥ
translated: must be accepted for the sake of the proximate injunction, and the impossibility of that for the sake of the distant injunction.

original: syāditi yugapat viruddhasaṃbhavāsaṃbhavāyogānna kvacit sakṛcchrutena pratyayena viśiṣṭavidhiḥ
analyzed: syāt iti yugapad viruddha saṃbhava asaṃbhava ayogāt na kvacid sakṛt śrutena pratyayena viśiṣṭa vidhiḥ
translated: It is not possible for a single word to enjoin a qualified object, because of the impossibility of the simultaneous presence of what is possible and what is impossible.

analyzed: saṃbhavati iti tvad ukta pūrvapakṣasya somena yajeta iti atra iva āgneya ādi vākyeṣu api saṃbhavāt aneka guṇa upādāna nimitta vākya bheda āpatti hetuka pūvrapakṣa abhidhānam āgneya ādi vākye
translated: Therefore, the prima facie view stated by you is possible in the case of the sentence one should sacrifice with soma as well as in the case of the sentences beginning with agneyaka, leading to the undesirable consequence of the split of the sentence due to the mention of multiple qualities.

analyzed: bhāṣyakārasya śūnya hṛdaya tām eva āpādayet
translated: It would only lead to the emptiness of the heart of the commentator in the case of the sentences beginning with agneyaka.

analyzed: atas saṅga ta tvāt guṇa vidhi nāmadheya vicāraḥ eva yuktaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, it is proper to consider the injunction of qualities and the name, as they are relevant.

analyzed: tad prakhya nyāyena āgneya pada nāma tva upapādanam
translated: The establishment of the word agneyaka as a name by the principle of tatprakhya (similarity to that).

original: kathaṃ tarhi nyāyasudhoktadūṣaṇasamūhe vidyamāne nāmatāpūrvapakṣasiddhirityata āha agneriti //
analyzed: katham tarhi nyāyasudhā ukta dūṣaṇa samūhe vidyamāne nāmatā pūrvapakṣa siddhiḥ iti atas āha agneḥ iti
translated: How then is the establishment of the prima facie view of being a name possible in the face of the multitude of objections stated in Nyayasudha? To this he says of Agni etc.

original: ayamarthaḥ yadyapyāgneyavākye bhavatinā sattāmātropādānādvidherbhāvanāyāḥ tadavacchedakayogyadhātvarthasya vā nopādānaṃ /
analyzed: ayam arthaḥ yadi api āgneya vākye bhavatinā sattā mātra upādānāt vidheḥ bhāvanāyāḥ tad avacchedaka yogya dhātvarthasya vā na upādānam
translated: The meaning is this: Although in the sentence agneyaka, the existence is merely mentioned by the word bhavati, and the injunction does not mention the bhāvanā (the act of becoming), nor does it mention the root meaning which is fit to be restricted by that (existence),

original: tathāpi aprāptārthatvādvidhiṃ prakalpya bhūdhātośca bhāvanāṃ vinānupapatteḥ bhāvanākṣepāttayaiva
analyzed: tathā api aprāpta artha tvāt vidhim prakalpya bhū dhātoḥ ca bhāvanām vinā anupapatteḥ bhāvanā ākṣepāt tayā eva
translated: Still, because of the meaning not being obtained, assuming an injunction, and because the verbal root cannot be established without an action, the action is implied by that.

analyzed: vā bhāvanā abhidhānāt tasyām ca prathama anta aṣṭākapāla pada ukta dravyasya anvaya asaṃbhave saktu vat prathamāyāḥ
translated: Or, because the action is denoted by that itself, and because the substance mentioned by the word aṣṭākapāla in the first case cannot be connected with that action, like saktu,

analyzed: karaṇa tva lakṣaṇayā aṣṭākapāla karaṇikāyām tasyām bhāvanāyām agneḥ api viśeṣaṇa tvena aneka vidhi nimitta gaurava āpatteḥ
translated: by the indication of the instrumentality of the first case, in that action which has aṣṭākapāla as its instrument, even if Agni is taken as a mere qualifier, there would be the undesirable consequence of the heaviness of having many injunctions as causes.

analyzed: tad prakhya nyāyena nāmadheyam āgneya padam
translated: Therefore, by the principle of tatprakhya, the word āgneya is a name.

analyzed: saṃbhavati ca atra mantra varṇasya agni devatā prāpakasya sattvāt tat prakhyat nyāyaḥ
translated: And here, the principle of tatprakhya is possible because there exists a mantra passage that conveys the deity Agni.

analyzed: mantra brāhmaṇa pāṭhayoḥ an anyādṛśa tvena anyādṛśa tve pi anuṣṭhāna sādeśyāt agniḥ mūrdhā ityādīnām āgneya ādi viniyogena māntravarṇika devatā prāpti samarthanam
translated: Even though the recitation of the mantra and the Brāhmaṇa is not exactly the same, and is different, because of the similarity of performance, the support of the attainment of the deity based on the mantra in the case of the mantras beginning with agniḥ mūrdhā, etc., by their application to the āgneya, etc., is established.

original: agnirmūrdheti puronuvākyāyā bhuvo yajñasye ti yājyāyāścādhikārākhyaprakaraṇena
analyzed: agniḥ mūrdhā iti puronuvākyāyāḥ bhuvaḥ yajñasya iti yājyāyāḥ ca adhikāra ākhya prakaraṇena
translated: By the context called the topic of the eligibility of the puronuvākyā beginning with agniḥ mūrdhā and the yājyā beginning with bhuvo yajñasya,

original: sthānena vā aṣṭākapālabhāvanāṅgatvāvagaterupāṃśuyājavat śrutyaviniyoge 'pi devatākalpakatvopapatteḥ /🔽ataeva dravyasamānādhikaraṇasyāpyāgneyapadasya nyāyena nāmatāsiddhau karmavyadhikaraṇadvitīyāntāgnihotrāghārapadavannāmatvaṃ karaṇatvalakṣaṇayāṃ
analyzed: sthānena vā aṣṭākapāla bhāvanā aṅgatva avagateḥ upāṃśuyāja vat śruti aviniyoge pi devatā kalpaka tva upapatteḥ  ataeva dravya samāna adhikaraṇasya api āgneya padasya nyāyena nāmatā siddhau karma vyadhikaraṇa dvitīya anta agnihotra āghāra pada vat nāmatvam karaṇa tva lakṣaṇayām
translated: Or, even when there is no application by direct statement, like the Upāṃśuyāja, the assumption of a deity is possible, because the connection of the Aṣṭākapāla with the act is understood from the injunction.

analyzed: na anupapannam  na ca adhikārasya upāṃśuyāja ādiṣu api aviśeṣāt kramasya ca brāhmaṇa pāṭha apekṣayā mantrāṇām
translated: And for the same reason, even though the word Āgneya has the substance as its primary meaning, when its being a name is established by reasoning, its being a name, like the word Āghāra in the sentence Āgnihotram āghārayati, which has the action as its primary meaning, is not impossible in the denotation of the instrument.

original: vaiparītyādasaṃbhavatt kathaṃ prathamasya prathamamityevaṃ pāṭhakramāt mantrāṇāmaṅgatvamiti dūṣaṇam /
analyzed: vaiparītyāt asaṃbhavat katham prathamasya prathamam iti evam pāṭha kramāt mantrāṇām aṅga tvam iti dūṣaṇam
translated: And the objection that how can the mantra be subsidiary by the order of recitation, 'the first of the first' etc., when the injunction is not specific in the Upāṃśuyāja etc., and the order is impossible because the mantras are in the reverse order compared to the order of the Brāhmaṇa recitation,

original: vājasaneyiśākhāyāṃ prathamamāgneyasya paścādagnīṣomīyasyaiva brāhmaṇapāṭhāmnānāt mantrāṇāṃ pāṭhakramopapatteḥ /
analyzed: vājasaneyi śākhāyām prathamam āgneyasya paścāt agnīṣomīyasya eva brāhmaṇa pāṭha āmnānāt mantrāṇām pāṭha krama upapatteḥ
translated: is not valid, because in the Vājasaneyi branch, the order of the mantras is possible because the Brāhmaṇa recitation mentions the Āgneya first and then the Āgneya-Soma only.

analyzed: sarva śākhā abhijña tvena viśvasta tantra vārtikakāraiḥ lekhanāt śākhā antare mantra pāṭha krama an āmnānasya anumātum api aśakya tvāt ca
translated: And because the author of the Tantravārtika, who knew all the branches, wrote it, the order of recitation of the mantras in other branches cannot be inferred even.

original: mantratastu virodhe syādityatra tu yatrāpi vyutkramāmnānaṃ /
analyzed: mantrataḥ tu virodhe syāt iti atra tu yatra api vyutkrama āmnānam
translated: But in the case of conflict with the mantra, it is so - here, even where there is a reverse order of recitation,

analyzed: tatra api iṣṭa siddhiḥ upapāditā
translated: the desired result has been established.

analyzed: na tu tāvatā sarvatra api vyutkrama āmnānam
translated: But that does not mean that there is a reverse order of recitation everywhere.

original: tadapyagnīṣomīyānantare paṭhitasyāpyāgneyasya śiro vā etadyajñasya yadāgneyo hṛdayamupāṃśuyājaḥ
analyzed: tat api agnīṣomīya anantare paṭhitasya api āgneyasya śiraḥ vai etat yajñasya yat āgneyaḥ hṛdayam upāṃśuyājaḥ
translated: Even that, though recited immediately after the Agnisomiya, of the Agnieya, the head is indeed this of the sacrifice, the Agnieya, the heart is the Upamsuyaja,

analyzed: pādau agnīṣomīyaḥ iti anena aprāpta artha tvena vidhi kalpanayā sva sthānāt apakṛṣya agnīṣomīya paśu yāga vat apakṛṣya anuṣṭhāna avagateḥ anuṣṭhāna
translated: the feet are the Agnisomiya - by this, being not already accomplished, by the assumption of an injunction, it is removed from its own place, and like the animal sacrifice of the Agnisomiya animal, it is understood to be performed after being removed,

analyzed: lakṣaṇa sthāna kramāt paśu dharmāṇām agnīṣomīya aṅga tvasya iva yājyā anuvākyā yugalasya aṅga tva avagatiḥ iti
translated: just as the characteristics of the animal rites are understood to be a part of the Agnisomiya animal sacrifice, so too the pair of Yajya and Anuvakya are understood to be a part.

analyzed: kaustubha darśita prakāreṇa aṅga tvasya sulabha tvāt ca  āgneyaḥ iti taddhitasya devatā pramāpaka tva śaṅkā tad nirasane
translated: And because the nature of being a part is easily understood by the method shown in the Kautsa.🔽In the word Agnieya, the doubt that the Taddhita suffix indicates the deity, and its refutation.

original: naca taddhitasya sarvadaivataprāpakapramāṇāpekṣayā balavatvāttenaiva devatāvidhānena durbalamāntravarṇikadevatākalpanaṃ na yuktamiti
analyzed: na ca tad hitasya sarva daivata prāpaka pramāṇa apekṣayā balavat tvāt tena eva devatā vidhānena durbala māntravarṇika devatā kalpanam na yuktam iti
translated: And it is not proper to assume the deity indicated by the mantra, which is weaker, when the deity is enjoined by that very word, because the Taddhita suffix is stronger than the means of knowing all deities.

analyzed: virodhe tad prābalye pi avirodhe na eka vidhi gaurava āpādaka tvena taddhitasya tad kalpaka tva ayogāt
translated: Even in the case of contradiction, the affix is not capable of supplying the deity, because in the absence of contradiction, it would entail the complication of enjoining many things.

original: sarvatrāgnikalibhyāṃ ḍhak vaktavya iti prāgdīvyatīyeṣu tasyedaṃ tasyāpatyaṃ
analyzed: sarvatra agni kalibhyām ḍhak vaktavyaḥ iti prāc dīvyatīyeṣu tasya idam tasya apatyam
translated: In all cases, the affix ḍhak should be used with agni and kali. This is the son of that.

original: sāsya devatā tasya samūhaḥ tatra bhava ityādisāmānyaviśeṣeṣu anekeṣu saṃbandheṣu🔽ḍhakpratyayasya smaraṇādāgneyapadasya sandigdhārthatvena niyamena devatāvidhāyitvānupapatteśca /

original: ata eva guṇādhikaraṇapūrvapakṣe vājamāmikṣārūpamannaṃ yeṣāṃ viśveṣāṃ devānāṃ te vājino viśvedevāstebhyo vājinamityarthāṅgīkāreṇaivotpattiśiṣṭaguṇaprābalyaśaṅkā 🔽nirastā /

translated: For this very reason, in the prima facie view of the chapter on qualities, the doubt of the superiority of the qualities prescribed in the originative injunction is removed by the mere acceptance of the meaning, by calling the food in the form of curds and food for the Viśvedevas 'Vājin', 'belonging to the Vājas'.

analyzed: tatra api śikye ghaṭaḥ asti tam ānaya ityādau sarvanāmnaḥ śuddha dravya parāmarśi tvasya darśanāt
translated: Even there, because of the seeing of the fact that in such expressions as 'the pot is in the basket, bring that', the pronoun refers to a pure substance,

analyzed: harivat ādīnām devatā tve pi eteṣām haviṣām indram eva yajanti iti vacana antara vihita indra devatāyāḥ
translated: even though the tawny one etc. are deities, and the offering to Indra, which is enjoined by another text, 'They offer these oblations to Indra alone',

analyzed: svīkārya tayā vaiṣamyāt

analyzed: aṣṭākapāla ādīnām tu tad anvaya ayogya tvāt viśeṣaḥ
translated: But in the case of aṣṭākapāla etc., there is a difference because they are not fit for that connection.

analyzed: yadi api prastuta dravya parāmarśe bahu tvāt bahuvacana āpattiḥ
translated: Even though, in the reference to the mentioned substance, there is the fault of the plural number due to plurality,

analyzed: vājina yāgasya pratipatti tvena āmikṣā yāga aṅga tvāt prakaraṇa asaṃbhavena yajina anuvāda asaṃbhava abhiprāyeṇa saptasu iti uktam

translated: is not proper. Therefore, the prima facie view of the difference of the ritual is rejected by Prakashkara.

analyzed: sarvanāmnām prakṛta parāmarśi tva niyama abhāvena tad guṇāḥ tu iti sūtre tad śabdasya iva buddhi stha parāmarśi tayā

analyzed: siddhāntam āha na āgneya ādiṣu iti
translated: He states the conclusion: Not in the agneya and other sacrifices.

The specific relation in the form of being the deity

original: tathaiva tatra śakyārthasyaivāprasidhyā tanniṣṭhaguṇayogābhāvāt siddhānte khapuṣpaśabdasya gauṇatvāsaṃbhavāt bhavaduktalakṣaṇasyāpyavyāptiḥ /
analyzed: tathā eva tatra śakyārthasya eva aprasidhyā tad niṣṭha guṇa yoga abhāvāt siddhānte khapuṣpa śabdasya gauṇa tva asaṃbhavāt bhavat ukta lakṣaṇasya api avyāptiḥ
translated: Similarly, in that case, due to the impossibility of the possible meaning itself, there is no connection with the quality residing in it, so in the doctrine, the word sky-flower cannot be secondary, and therefore your stated definition also has over-extension.

analyzed: iti āśaṅkā nirāsāya āha puṣpa ādau iti
translated: To remove this doubt, he says in the case of a flower etc.

analyzed: āropita artha vṛtti tva rūpa tad lakṣaṇasya asmat ukta rīti āropita khapuṣpam ādāya avastu svarūpa nirūpaṇe
translated: The definition consisting of the nature of functioning with a superimposed meaning, according to our method of statement, taking a superimposed sky-flower, in the specification of the nature of a non-entity,

analyzed: na āropa upapādane vyāpti abhāve piśa puṣpa śabdaḥ eva latā puṣpe āropita artha vṛtti tva sattvena
translated: Even in the absence of over-extension in the case of superimposition and non-superimposition, the word sky-flower itself would become secondary due to the existence of the superimposed meaning in a creeper flower,
leading to the fault of over-extension.

analyzed: nahi loke khapuṣpa śabdasya gauṇa tvam kenacid ucyate
translated: For no one says that the word sky-flower is secondary in the world.

analyzed: yatas iṣṭa āpattiḥ ucyate
translated: Because it is said to be a desired consequence.

original: etena āropyasya siṃhatvādergauṇatvāprasiddherāropitāśraye devadattādāveva tatprasiddherāropitārthāśrayatvameva gauṇatvam iti parāharam /🔽khapuṣpasya svayamevāprasiddhasyāropitatvāsaṃbhavāt prasiddhe khe latādau prasiddhasya
analyzed: etena āropyasya siṃha tva ādeḥ gauṇa tva aprasiddheḥ āropita āśraye devadatta ādau eva tad prasiddheḥ āropita artha āśraya tvam eva gauṇa tvam iti  khapuṣpasya svayam eva aprasiddhasya āropita tva asaṃbhavāt prasiddhe khe latā ādau prasiddhasya
translated: By this, the opponent's argument that since the secondary nature of the superimposed lionhood etc. is not well-known, it is well-known only in Devadatta etc., the substratum of the superimposed, and therefore secondary nature is the state of being the substratum of the superimposed meaning, is refuted.

analyzed: puṣpasya eva āropitasya aṅgīkāreṇa prasiddhi upapādane āropita artha āśraya tvasya khe sattvāt
translated: Because a sky-flower, which is itself unknown, cannot be superimposed, and by accepting that only a well-known flower is superimposed on a well-known sky or creeper, and by explaining it as well-known, the state of being the substratum of the superimposed meaning exists in the sky,

analyzed: khapuṣpe khapuṣpa śabdasya gauṇa tva anivāraṇāt ativyāpteḥ amukteḥ
translated: the secondary nature of the word sky-flower with respect to the sky-flower is not excluded, and over-extension is not avoided.

analyzed: atas tvad mate tivyāpti doṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, in your view, there is the fault of over-extension.

original: mamatu śakyaśabdena mukhyārthamātravivakṣaṇādāropitasya mukhyārthatānapāyāt na kopi doṣaḥ /
analyzed: mama tu śakya śabdena mukhya artha mātra vivakṣaṇāt āropitasya mukhya artha tā anapāyāt na kaḥ api doṣaḥ
translated: But in my view, since the primary meaning alone is intended by the word possible, and the superimposed does not cease to be the primary meaning, there is no fault at all.

analyzed: nahi mukhya tvam anāropita tva kṛtam
translated: For being primary is not due to not being superimposed.

analyzed: kintu vṛtti antaram an apekṣya śabda prayoga kṛtam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But the meaning is that it is due to the use of the word without depending on another function.

original: naca tathāpi khapuṣpaṃ bhavatsiddhānta iti vadatā bauddhenopameyabhūtasya siddhāntasyānabhyupagamāt vastuto 'satye tasmin kathaṃ guṇayogābhāve
analyzed: na ca tathā api khapuṣpam bhavat siddhāntaḥ iti vadatā bauddhena upameya bhūtasya siddhāntasya anabhyupagamāt vastutas satye tasmin katham guṇa yoga abhāve
translated: And even so, it is not that your doctrine is like a sky-flower, because the Buddhist who says this does not accept the doctrine which is the object of comparison. So how can it be said that there is no connection with the qualities,

original: iti vācyam / siddhāntapadābhidheyasya niścayasya sadrūpābhāvena bhramatve 'pi svarūpeṇa vidyamānatayopameyatvopapatteḥ /
analyzed: iti vācyam siddhānta pada abhidheyasya niścayasya sat rūpa abhāvena bhrama tve pi sva rūpeṇa vidyamāna tayā upameya tva upapatteḥ
translated: when that is actually unreal? This should be said: Even though the object denoted by the word doctrine, which is a definite cognition, is a delusion due to the absence of a real form, it is still logically possible to be the object of comparison by its own nature.

original: evamevapuṣpavikārātmanā khasyāsatyatve 'pi svātmano rūpeṇa satyatvāt sādṛśyapratiyogitvamākāśasyaiveti nopamānānupapattiḥ /🔽etacca khelatāpuṣpasyaivāropeṇa pārthasārathyādyabhimatenoktam /
analyzed: evam eva puṣpa vikāra ātmanā khasya asatya tve pi sva ātmanaḥ rūpeṇa satya tvāt sādṛśya pratiyogi tvam ākāśasya eva iti nā upamāna anupapattiḥ  etat ca khelatā puṣpasya eva āropeṇa pārthasārathi ādi abhimatena uktam
translated: In the same way, even though the sky is unreal in the form of a flower modification, the sky itself is the counter-correlate of similarity because of its existence in its own form. So there is no impossibility of comparison.🔽This is said only by way of superimposing a flower on the sky, as accepted by Pārthasārathi and others.

original: yadā tu latāpuṣpe khādhikaraṇatāropa iti pūjyapādānāmabhipretam /
analyzed: yadā tu latā puṣpe kha adhikaraṇa tā āropaḥ iti pūjya pādānām abhipretam
translated: But when the venerable Pādas accept the superimposition of the sky as the substratum of the creeper flower,

original: tadā latāpuṣpasyaivopamānatvena khādhikaraṇatākatvenāsatyatve 'pi latāpuṣpātmanā satyatvena sādṛśyapratiyogitayopamānatvopapattiḥ sulabhaiva
analyzed: tadā latā puṣpasya eva upamāna tvena kha adhikaraṇa tāka tvena asatya tve pi latā puṣpa ātmanā satya tvena sādṛśya pratiyogitayā upamāna tva upapattiḥ sulabhā eva
translated: Then, even though the sky-flower is unreal, being the substratum of the relation of the qualifier and qualified with the flower, it is easily established as the counter-correlate of similarity by being the flower itself in reality, as the example of the flower.

original: ata evaitanmate khapuṣpasyaivopamānatvapratītirnaiva bādhitā bhavatītyapi jñeyam /
analyzed: atas eva etad mate khapuṣpasya eva upamāna tva pratītiḥ na eva bādhitā bhavati iti api jñeyam
translated: For this very reason, it should be known that the cognition of the sky-flower itself as the example is not contradicted in this view.

original: yattu vārtike āropitapuṣpaṃ vinaiva khādhārapuṣpāvacchinnābhāvavācitvam khapuṣpaśabdasya varṇitam /
analyzed: yat tu vārtike āropita puṣpam vinā eva kha ādhāra puṣpa avacchinna abhāva vāci tvam khapuṣpa śabdasya varṇitam
translated: But in the Vartika (commentary), it is described that the word 'sky-flower' denotes the absence qualified by a sky-flower without any superimposed flower.

analyzed: tat kaustubhe eva upapādya nirastam draṣṭavyam
translated: That should be seen as explained and refuted in the Kousthubha (commentary).

analyzed: atas sva ukta lakṣaṇasya veda aprāmāṇya anāpādaka tvāt yuktatva āśayena upasaṃharati atas ca etādṛśa iti
translated: Therefore, because the definition stated by him does not entail the invalidity of the Vedas, he concludes with the idea that it is correct, saying Thus, such...

analyzed: guṇa nimittaka vṛtti saṃbandhāt śabda artha vṛtti gauṇa pada abhilapya tva upapādakam sādṛśya vivakṣayā kṛtam etādṛśa śabda arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of such a word is made by the intention of similarity, which justifies being denoted by a secondary word that occurs in the meaning of the word, due to the relation of occurrence caused by the quality.

original: yadyapica puruṣo vāva gautamāgnirityādau vede 'pyāropo dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yadi api ca puruṣaḥ vāva gautama agniḥ ityādau vede pi āropaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: And although superimposition is seen even in the Veda, such as Man indeed, O Gautama, is the fire,

analyzed: tathā api tatra adṛṣṭa phala artham upāsakasya upāsanā rūpa āropa vidhi saṃbhave pi iha tad abhāve
translated: Even so, there, although for the purpose of unseen results, for the worshipper, the injunction of superimposition in the form of worship is possible, here, in the absence of that,

analyzed: vede vaktuḥ abhāve ca tad kṛta āropa anupapatteḥ dṛṣṭa vyavahārasya anyathā api upapatteḥ na āropa kalpanam
translated: and in the Veda, in the absence of the speaker, the superimposition created by him being impossible, and the seen usage being possible in another way also, the assumption of superimposition

analyzed: yuktam iti sva lakṣaṇasya vede saṃbhava uktyā sūcitam
translated: is not proper. This is indicated by the statement of the possibility of the specific individuality in the Veda.

analyzed: sva śakya samaveta ityādi gauṇa lakṣaṇa samanvayaḥ
translated: The inclusion of the secondary definition beginning with inhering in what is capable of being related to itself

original: devadatte krūratvādivat siṃhatvasyāpyāropeṇa gauṇīdarśanādubhayasādhāraṇyāya lakṣaṇe guṇapadaṃ samavetaparamityupetya lakṣaṇamāha svaśakyeti
analyzed: devadatte krūra tva ādi vat siṃha tvasya api āropeṇa gauṇī darśanāt ubhaya sādhāraṇyāya lakṣaṇe guṇa padam samaveta param iti upetya lakṣaṇam āha sva śakya iti
translated: is explained. Since the secondary usage is seen in Devadatta, like cruelty etc., in the case of lionhood also, the word quality in the definition is accepted as referring to inherence, in order to make it common to both, and the definition is stated as inhering in what is capable of being related to itself.

analyzed: kvacid āropeṇa iti
translated: In some cases, by superimposition means

original: yatra rūpakādau satyapi bhedadarśane sādṛśyamātreṇa siṃhatvakrūratvādi devadatte vaktāropya siṃhaśabdaḥ prayujyate /
analyzed: yatra rūpaka ādau sati api bheda darśane sādṛśya mātreṇa siṃha tva krūra tva ādi devadatte vaktā āropya siṃha śabdaḥ prayujyate
translated: where, even though the difference is seen, by mere similarity, lionhood, cruelty etc. are superimposed on Devadatta by the speaker, and the word lion is used.

analyzed: śrotrā ca tathā eva pratipadyate
translated: And the listener understands it in the same way.

original: tatrānubhavasiddhāropāpahnave pramāṇābhāvāt siṃhatvādīnāmāropeṇa sākṣādeva devadatte svaśaktyā siṃhasamavetasiṃhatvādisadbhāvāllakṣaṇasamanvaya
analyzed: tatra anubhava siddha āropa apahnave pramāṇa abhāvāt siṃha tva ādīnām āropeṇa sākṣāt eva devadatte sva śaktyā siṃha samaveta siṃha tva ādi sadbhāvāt lakṣaṇa samanvaya
translated: There, because there is no proof for superimposition and denial of what is established by experience, by the superimposition of lion-ness etc., directly in Devadatta himself, by his own power, due to the existence of lion-ness etc. inherent in the lion, there is the connection of the definition.

analyzed: iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

analyzed: kvacid eva iti
translated: In some cases only,

original: svaśakye siṃhe vidyamānaiḥ prasahyakāritvādiguṇaiḥ samānajātīyaguṇānāṃ devadatte sattvena sādṛśyamātravivakṣayāpi devadatte siṃhaśabdaprayoge
analyzed: sva śakye siṃhe vidyamānaiḥ prasahyakāri tva ādi guṇaiḥ samāna jātīya guṇānām devadatte sattvena sādṛśya mātra vivakṣayā api devadatte siṃha śabda prayoge
translated: in the lion which is his own object, by the qualities such as overpowering nature which are present, by the mere desire to speak of similarity, even in the use of the word 'lion' in Devadatta, due to the existence of qualities of the same class in Devadatta,
there is the connection of the definition. This is the meaning.

original: svaśakyasamavetetyādilakṣaṇasya lakṣyamāṇaguṇairyogāditi vārtikāvirodhasamarthanena prācāṃ matena guṇānāṃ lakṣaṇayā bodhopapattiḥ
analyzed: sva śakya samaveta ityādi lakṣaṇasya lakṣyamāṇa guṇaiḥ yogāt iti vārtikā virodha samarthanena prācām matena guṇānām lakṣaṇayā bodha upapattiḥ
translated: The establishment of the compatibility of the definition beginning with 'inherent in what is its own object' etc. with the Vartika by proving the non-contradiction with the qualities to be defined is the establishment of the compatibility of the understanding of the qualities by lakṣaṇā according to the opinion of the ancients.

analyzed: atra ca abhidheya avinābhūte pravṛttiḥ lakṣaṇā iṣyate
translated: And here, the application of the definition is desired to be in inseparable relation with the denoted object.

analyzed: lakṣyamāṇa guṇaiḥ yogāt vṛtteḥ iṣṭā tu gauṇa tā
translated: But the secondary sense is desired due to the connection with the qualities to be defined.

original: iti lakṣaṇābhedanirūpaṇaparavārtike uktaṃ lakṣyamāṇaguṇayoganimittatvalakṣaṇaṃ gauṇyā na yuktam /
analyzed: iti lakṣaṇa abheda nirūpaṇa para vārtike uktam lakṣyamāṇa guṇa yoga nimitta tva lakṣaṇam gauṇyā na yuktam
translated: This definition of the cause of secondary sense as the connection with the qualities to be defined, as stated in the Vartika which deals with the determination of the varieties of lakṣaṇā, is not proper.

analyzed: tathātve jahat svārtha tā āpatteḥ
translated: Because in that case, there would be the fault of abandoning its own meaning.

analyzed: tad vāraṇāya svārtha mātra paratve guṇānām aśābdatva āpattiḥ
translated: To avoid that, if the qualities are taken as merely referring to their own meaning, there would be the fault of the qualities not being denoted.

original: ataḥ siṃhaśabdena śakyārthaṃ pūrvaṃ śaktyanusāreṇābhidhāya guṇā api lakṣaṇayocyante /🔽ato lakṣyamāṇaguṇairityantaṃ samānādhikaraṇasamāsāṅgīkāreṇa svārthābhidhānapūrvikā
analyzed: atas siṃha śabdena śakya artham pūrvam śakti anusāreṇa abhidhāya guṇāḥ api lakṣaṇayā ucyante  atas lakṣyamāṇa guṇaiḥ ityantam samāna adhikaraṇa samāsa aṅgīkāreṇa svārtha abhidhāna pūrvikā
translated: Therefore, after first denoting the meaning that can be denoted by the word 'lion' in accordance with its power, the qualities are also stated by secondary signification.🔽Therefore, in the Vārtika on 'with qualities that are indicated', by accepting the compound as having the same case ending, the qualities are stated by secondary signification after the denoting of their own meaning,

original: guṇeṣu lakṣaṇeti vārtike ukte ti nyāyasudhāyāṃ vyākhyānena guṇalakṣaṇaṃ prācāmabhimatāmabhipretya
analyzed: guṇeṣu lakṣaṇā iti vārtike uktā nyāyasudhāyām vyākhyānena guṇa lakṣaṇam prācām abhimatām abhipretya
translated: as stated in the Nyāyasudhā commentary on the Vārtika. Having in mind the accepted view of the ancients that the qualities are indicated,

analyzed: tad matam upapādayati atra iti  gauṇyā aṅguṇānām upasthitau sva matasya sva śakya ityādi lakṣaṇa lakṣyamāṇa guṇa vārtikayoḥ avirodha upapādana pūrvakam tatra nyāyasudhā ādi khaṇḍana pūrvakam  yugapad vṛtti dvaya virodha āpatteḥ mukhya artha guṇavat upasthiti artham āśritayā gauṇyā eva avacchedakībhūta guṇa śābda bodha upapatteḥ a
translated: he explains their view with 'atra' etc.🔽In the establishment of the qualities by secondary signification, the non-contradiction of the Vārtikas on 'with qualities that are indicated' and 'its own possible' with his own view, after explaining it in the Nyāyasudhā etc.,🔽because of the contradiction of the simultaneous occurrence of two usages, by resorting to the secondary signification that is the qualifier, the cognition of the qualities that are denoted is established.

analyzed: śābda tva aprasaṅgāt niṣprayojanam guṇeṣu lakṣaṇa aṅgīkaraṇam iti asvarasāt āha vastutas tu iti
translated: Because of the non-applicability of the fault of being denoted, the acceptance of secondary signification in the qualities is purposeless. Therefore, he says 'in reality' etc. without enthusiasm.

original: lakṣaṇāyā apyupasthitārthasyaiva śābdatvasidhyarthamaṅgīkārāt gauṇyāmapyāvaśyakīṃ guṇopasthitiṃ sādhayati ekasaṃbandhīti //
analyzed: lakṣaṇāyāḥ api upasthita arthasya eva śābdatva sidhi artham aṅgīkārāt gauṇyām api āvaśyakīm guṇa upasthitim sādhayati eka saṃbandhi iti
translated: Even in secondary usage, the necessary presence of the quality is established by the statement that which is related to one.

analyzed: evam ca lakṣyamāṇa guṇaiḥ iti vārtike na karmadhāraya saṃbandhaḥ
translated: And thus in the Vartika laksyamāṇaguṇaiḥ, there is no Karmadhāraya relation.

analyzed: kintu siṃha tva agni tva jāti vācaka padena yā lakṣyamāṇā vyaktiḥ
translated: But the individual that is indicated by the word denoting the class of lion-ness or fire,

analyzed: tad niṣṭha guṇaiḥ iti ṣaṣṭhī tatpuruṣaḥ eva
translated: with the qualities belonging to that, is the sixth Tatpurusha only.

original: ata eva vārtike yathā pūrvārdhe lakṣaṇayā abhidheyāvinābhūtasaṃbandhādaraḥ pradarśyate evamuttarārdhe mukhyārthasādṛśyarūpādaramātraṃ /
analyzed: atas eva vārtike yathā pūrva ardhe lakṣaṇayā abhidheya avinābhūta saṃbandha ādaraḥ pradarśyate evam uttara ardhe mukhya artha sādṛśya rūpa ādara mātram
translated: For this very reason, in the Vartika, just as in the first part, the respect for the relation inseparable from the denoted meaning by secondary usage is shown, in the same way, in the second part, only the respect in the form of similarity to the primary meaning is shown.

original: natu lakṣaṇā guṇeṣu /🔽ataeva vahnitvalakṣitādarthāt yatpaiṅgalyādi gamyate /
analyzed: na tu lakṣaṇā guṇeṣu  ataeva vahni tva lakṣitāt arthāt yat paiṅgalya ādi gamyate
translated: But there is no secondary usage in the qualities.🔽For this very reason, in the subsequent statement, The whiteness etc. that is understood from the meaning indicated by the class of fire,

analyzed: tena māṇavake buddhiḥ sādṛśyāt upajāyate
translated: By that, the cognition arises in the boy through similarity.

analyzed: iti uttara vākye gamyate iti evam uktam
translated: It is said in this way that it is understood.

analyzed: tathā saṃbhavati ca atra siṃha tva avagata vyakti upasthāpita prasahyakāri tva ādi aneka dharma pratyayāt
translated: And in this case, the cognition of the individual understood through the class of lion-ness arises from the cognition of the many properties such as the ability to kill etc. that are presented.

original: devadattapratyaya iti pūrvaiva śaktirnimittaṃ iti vārtike pūrvaśaktereva nimittatvaṃ gauṇyāmuktam /
analyzed: devadatta pratyayaḥ iti pūrvā eva śaktiḥ nimittam iti vārtike pūrva śakteḥ eva nimitta tvam gauṇyām uktam
translated: In the Vartika the power of the previous word is the cause, the author has stated that only the power of the previous word is the cause in the case of secondary meaning.

original: natu guṇalakṣaṇāyā iti nyāyasudhākṛto guṇalakṣaṇāparatayā vyākhyānamanyāyyameveti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na tu guṇa lakṣaṇāyāḥ iti nyāyasudhā kṛtaḥ guṇa lakṣaṇā para tayā vyākhyānam anyāyyam eva iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But not of figurative meaning. Therefore the explanation of the author of Nyāyasudhā as being based on figurative meaning is itself unreasonable. This is the idea.

analyzed: nanu siṃha ādi padānām siṃha saṃbandhi lakṣaṇayā eva devadatta pada sāmānādhikaraṇya upapatteḥ
translated: Now, since the co-reference with the word Devadatta is possible for words like 'lion' etc. only through the figurative meaning related to the lion,

analyzed: kim iti atirikta gauṇī vṛtti samaṅgīkāraḥ iti āśaṅkām abheda āśaṅkā nirāsa dvārā bheda āpādanena
translated: why accept an additional figurative meaning? This doubt is removed by the author through the implication of difference, by denying the non-difference.

analyzed: nirasyati na ca iti
translated: He says not so etc.

analyzed: abhidheya avinābhūte iti pūrva likhita vārtike na lakṣaṇā hetu tvena avinābhāva upapādanam
translated: In the previously written Vartika that which is inseparable from the denoted object, the inseparability is not explained as the cause of figurative meaning.

analyzed: tasyāḥ saṃbandha mātreṇa śabda tātparya vaśāt upapatteḥ
translated: Because that is established by the mere relation with it through the intention of the word.

analyzed: nava atra lakṣaṇasya abhidheyasya lakṣyena avinābhāvaḥ gninā iva dhūmasya uktaḥ  lakṣyasya eva lakṣaka abhidheya avinābhāva kathanāt

analyzed: a paśavaḥ iti

analyzed: nāma tva āśaṅkāyāḥ asaṃbhavena tām upekṣya anyathā anupapatteḥ paśu pade paśu kārya lakṣaṇām aṅgīkṛtya

The word 'non-animal' indicates the absence of excellence in cows, horses, etc. Therefore, the praise is explained as the result by being in the same sentence as the injunction.
The praise is said to be the secondary cause as a component of the absence of praise.
The word 'non-animal', ending with a compound with the negative particle, being a word denoting a pot, etc., by being in the same sentence as the injunction of cows and horses, in the Arthavada,

original: 'pi ca paśavo goaśvā iti sāmānādhikaraṇyāt ekasaṃbandhijñānenāparasaṃbandhismaraṇavidhayā🔽gavāśvagataprāśastyābhāvasya śakyārthaniṣṭhasyopasthāpakam /🔽ataśca gavāśvagataprāśastyābhāvarūpaguṇayogenājādiṣu gauṇyā vṛttyopapanna iti arthāt nahinindānyāyena vidheyagatāśvagataprāśastyāvagatiḥ sulabhā

analyzed: yadi api arthavādasya gavāśva gata prāśastya lakṣaṇayā api upapatteḥ na tad gata prāśastya abhāva kathanasya upayogaḥ
translated: Although the Arthavada is also appropriate by the indication of the excellence in cows and horses, there is no use of stating the absence of excellence in them.

original: ataeva paśuśabdasya nimittāntarāsaṃbhavena nimittatvenāśritāyā api gavāśvagatapraśaṃsāyā vidhyekavākyatayeva phalatvenāpyāśrayaṇānna vaiyarthyaśaṅkāpi

translated: For this very reason, even though the praise of cows and horses is based on the word animal as the cause due to the impossibility of another cause, there is no doubt of uselessness because it is resorted to as the result even by the same sentence as the injunction.

original: evañca praśaṃsābhāvarūpe guṇe vyāvartyamānatayā praśaṃsāyāḥ praviṣṭatvamādāyaiva sūtre praśaṃsāyā nimittāntaratvenopādānaṃ draṣṭavyam /🔽yathāśrute gavāśvagatapraśaṃsāyāḥ śakyārthaghaṭādiguṇatvasyājādiguṇatvasya vāsaṃbhavāt

translated: And thus, in the quality which is in the form of praise, the praise is to be seen as entered by way of being excluded, and the praise is to be seen in the sutra as being used as a different cause.🔽If it is taken literally, the praise of cows and horses cannot be the quality of the possible object pot etc. or the quality of the goat etc.,

analyzed: pratyuta vidheya gavāśva ādi praśaṃsā artham anyeṣām aja ādīnām aprāśastyasya eva apekṣaṇāt ca guṇatā anupapatteḥ
translated: rather, for the purpose of praising the cows and horses to be enjoined, the non-excellence of the others, the goats etc., is itself required, and therefore the quality is not possible.

analyzed: atas ca a paśu śabdaḥ viśiṣṭaḥ eva atra gauṇaḥ
translated: And therefore the word 'apashu' is only a secondary one with a specific meaning here.
The opinion of Nyayasu-dhakara is that the word 'pashu' (animal) denotes excellence.
The determination of the non-authoritativeness indicated by the word 'tu' (but).🔽But by the authoritativeness of the vrtti (commentary), it is said by Nyayasu-dhakara and others

analyzed: yat tu gavāśva ādi gatām pūrvam upādāya praśasta tām
translated: that the excellence which is previously obtained in cows, horses, etc.,

translated: It has been explained that by the word paśu (animal) which is a part of the compound with na (not), excellence is indicated, and by the compound with na (not), the absence of that in other animals is stated.

translated: It has been explained in the Kautubha that it is not proper to explain it as a secondary usage, because the word apaśu (non-animal) can be applied to horses etc. just like to pots etc. by the same indication, and because there is no possibility of explaining it as a secondary usage.

analyzed: eva a paśu śabdāt pratīyeta

analyzed: na tu lakṣaṇayā
translated: But not by indication.

original: tathāca prathamato 'paśuśabdena nañsamāsāntena śaktyaiva paśubhinnamarthamabhidhāya tanniṣṭhaguṇayogena paścāt gauṇatvamupapādanīyam /

The conclusion, preceded by the explanation of the figurative cause of praise in other examples such as ayajñasatna etc.,

translated: Nevertheless, in order to avoid the lack of Sāman, the injunctions such as O Agni, come which are enjoined as substitutes for Sāman,

analyzed: santi tat satram pañcadaśa rātra ādi praśastam
translated: There are praised fifteen-night sessions etc.

original: yatratu caturdaśarātre ādye prāyaṇīyaṃ aharmadhye pṛṣṭhyaḥ ṣaḍahīyānyānulomavilomatayā🔽dvādaśadinānyete udayanīya ityevaṃ ahaḥ kḷptau madhye chandomānāmabhāvāt satrabhūto
analyzed: yatra tu caturdaśa rātre ādye prāyaṇīyam ahar madhye pṛṣṭhyaḥ ṣaḍahīyānya anuloma viloma tayā  dvādaśa dināni ete udayanīye iti evam ahar kḷptau madhye chandomānām abhāvāt satra bhūtaḥ
translated: Where in a fourteen-night session, the first day is the preparatory day, in the middle the six-day Prsthya is performed in the forward and reverse order,🔽and these twelve days are the concluding day, thus in the arrangement of days, in the middle there being no Chandramas, even the fourteen-night session,

analyzed: caturdaśa rātraḥ satra gata chandoma kṛta prāśastya abhāvāt asatram gauṇyā vṛttyā satra padena ucyate
translated: which has become a session, is not a session due to the absence of the praise produced by the Chandramas in the session, and is spoken of by the word 'session' in the secondary sense.

original: tena chandomarahitanindayā chandomarūpāvayavastutyā ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaḥ pañcadaśarātramāsate iti vihitapañcadaśarātrarūpāvayavistutiriti draṣṭavyam🔽evaṃ svamate prācāṃ mate vā gavāśvagataprāśastyabodhanaprakārabhede 'pi pratiyogividhayā
analyzed: tena chandoma rahita nindayā chandoma rūpa avayava stutyā ye evam vidvāṃsaḥ pañcadaśa rātram āsate iti vihita pañcadaśa rātra rūpa avayavi stutiḥ iti draṣṭavyam  evam sva mate prācām mate vā gavāśva gata prāśastya bodhana prakāra bhede pi pratiyogi vidhayā
translated: Therefore, it should be seen that by the censure of what is devoid of Chandramas, there is praise of the whole consisting of the fifteen-night session, which is enjoined as 'Those who know thus perform the fifteen-night session', by the principle of the praise of the part in the form of the Chandramas.🔽Thus, in our view or in the view of the ancients, even though there is a difference in the way of understanding the praise pertaining to cows and horses, it is understood that there is no dispute that the praise, which has entered by way of the counter-correlate,

original: praviṣṭāyāḥ praśaṃsāyā gauṇīnimittatve naiva vivāda ityabhipretyopasaṃharati sarvatheti //
analyzed: praviṣṭāyāḥ praśaṃsāyāḥ gauṇī nimitta tve na eva vivādaḥ iti abhipretya upasaṃharati sarvathā iti
translated: is the secondary cause. With this in mind, he concludes with the word 'sarvathā' (in every way).

analyzed: iti tad siddhi peṭikāyām praśaṃsā udāharaṇa vicāraḥ
translated: Thus ends the consideration of examples of praise in the chapter on the establishment of that (praise) in the Tattvaṭīkā.

original: pūrvodāharaṇena saṃgatinirūpaṇapūrvakaṃ sṛṣṭipadārthanirūpaṇapūrvakaṃ ca sṛṣṭiviśiṣṭopadhānavidhānamiti bhāṣyakāramatopapādanam
analyzed: pūrva udāharaṇena saṃgati nirūpaṇa pūrvakam sṛṣṭi padārtha nirūpaṇa pūrvakam ca sṛṣṭi viśiṣṭa upadhāna vidhānam iti bhāṣyakāra mata upapādanam
translated: The explanation of the opinion of the commentator that the injunction of the upasthāna qualified by creation is preceded by the determination of the meaning of the word creation and the determination of the connection in the previous example.

original: pūrvatra vidhyantaraikavākyatvādinār'thavādatve siddhe yatra na tattatra vidhitvasyaivānarthakyaparihārāya
analyzed: pūrvatra vidhi antara eka vākya tva ādinā arthavāda tve siddhe yatra na tat tatra vidhi tvasya eva ānarthakya parihārāya
translated: In the previous case, when the nature of being an arthavāda is established by the oneness of the injunction and so on, where that is not the case, the acceptance of the nature of being an injunction itself for the purpose of avoiding meaninglessness,

original: svīkāra iti pratyudāharaṇadarśanena saṃgatiṃ pratyudāharaṇarūpāṃ sūcayan vidhāvapi🔽gauṇīvṛttinimittāntarakathanārthatvamadhikaraṇāntarasyeti darśayitumudāharati sṛṣṭīriti //
analyzed: svīkāraḥ iti pratyudāharaṇa darśanena saṃgatim pratyudāharaṇa rūpām sūcayan vidhau api  gauṇī vṛtti nimitta antara kathana ārthatvam adhikaraṇa antarasya iti darśayitum udāharati sṛṣṭīḥ iti
translated: indicating the form of the counterexample with regard to the connection by showing the counterexample, even in the case of an injunction,🔽in order to explain the other cause of secondary usage, he gives an example with the words the creations.

analyzed: yadi api atra arthavāda tva asaṃbhavena vidhāyaka tve āvaśyake sati anupadhīyamānābhiḥ iṣṭakābhiḥ cayanasya
translated: Although here, when the nature of being an injunction is necessary due to the impossibility of being an arthavāda, and when the piling up with the bricks that are not being piled up

analyzed: kartum aśakya tvena iṣṭakābhiḥ agnim cinute iti vidhi anyathā anupapattyā eva sva rūpeṇa iṣṭakā saṃbandhi tvena
translated: is impossible, by the impossibility of the injunction one should pile up the fire with bricks, by its own form, by the connection with the bricks,

original: copadhānasya prāptau guṇasaṃkrāntavidhiśaktikatayopadhānānuvādena sṛṣṭipadārtha eva vidhātuṃ yuktaḥ /
analyzed: ca upadhānasya prāptau guṇa saṃkrānta vidhi śaktika tayā upadhāna anuvādena sṛṣṭi padārthaḥ eva vidhātum yuktaḥ
translated: When the placing is obtained, it is proper to enjoin the meaning of the word 'creation' by reiterating the placing, by the power of the injunction of the transference of the quality.

analyzed: saḥ pi ca na iṣṭakā rūpaḥ
translated: And that also is not in the form of what is desired.

original: iṣṭakānāṃ sṛṣṭirūpatvānavagamāt /🔽apitu sṛṣṭitanmātropadheyeṣṭakāsu sṛṣṭipadasya sṛṣṭimantraparasya lakṣaṇāmaṅgīkṛtyeṣṭakānāṃ
analyzed: iṣṭakānām sṛṣṭi rūpa tva an avagamāt  apitu sṛṣṭi tanmātra upadheya iṣṭakāsu sṛṣṭi padasya sṛṣṭi mantra parasya lakṣaṇām aṅgīkṛtya iṣṭakānām
translated: Because the form of creation of the bricks is not understood.🔽But accepting the figurative sense of the word 'creation' in the bricks which are to be placed with creation alone,

analyzed: sṛṣṭi pada abhidheya tve pi kāsām iṣṭakānām sṛṣṭi mantraiḥ upadhānam iti viśeṣa anavagamāt
translated: even though the bricks are denoted by the word 'creation', because the particular is not understood - which bricks are to be placed with the mantras of creation?

analyzed: iṣṭakā sāmānyasya ca iṣṭakā vidhinā eva upadhāna saṃbandhe prāpte tad viśeṣasya sutarām upadhāna saṃbandha prāpteḥ
translated: And because the connection of the general bricks with the placing is obtained by the injunction of the bricks itself, and the connection of that particular with the placing is obtained even more,

original: vidhānāyogāt pāriśeṣyāt tisṛbhirastughata brahmāsṛjyate tyādisṛjidhātuyuktasṛṣṭiliṅgakamantrarūpa eva /
analyzed: vidhāna ayogāt pāriśeṣyāt tisṛbhiḥ astughata brahmā asṛjyate eva
translated: because of the impossibility of enjoining, by the remainder, let it be with the three. The creation of Brahman is created, etc. The mantra in the form of the root 'sṛji' which has the mark of creation.

original: yattu prācīnaiḥ tadvānāsāmupadhāno mantra iti iṣṭakāsu luk ca mato riti smṛtermatuplopena sṛṣṭyabhidhāyimantrairupadheyānāmiṣṭakānāṃ
analyzed: yat tu prācīnaiḥ tadvān āsām upadhānaḥ mantraḥ iti iṣṭakāsu luk ca smṛteḥ matup lopena sṛṣṭi abhidhāyi mantraiḥ upadheyānām iṣṭakānām
translated: But what was said by the ancients - that the mantra is for the placing of those bricks, and that the elision of the bricks is considered by the Smṛti rule 'matuplopa' - by the elision of the matup affix, the bricks to be placed with the mantras expressing creation,

analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: that is not correct.

original: tathātve sanniyogaśiṣṭasya pratyayasya ṛtavyā upadadhātī tivanmatuplopena saha prāptyāpatteḥ /
analyzed: tathātve sanniyoga śiṣṭasya pratyayasya ṛtavyāḥ upadadhāti tivat matup lopena saha prāpti āpatteḥ
translated: If it were so, then the affix denoting injunction, like in the sentence one should lay down the Ṛtu bricks, would be obtained along with the elision of the matup affix.

original: naca eeevaṃ bhavanmate 'pi mantratvavivakṣāyāṃ matup durnivāra iti vācyam /
analyzed: naca bhavat mate mantra tva vivakṣāyām matup durnivāraḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that even in your view, when the nature of being a mantra is intended, the matup affix cannot be avoided.

analyzed: matup prakaraṇena tasya lopa āśrayaṇe yat pratyaya lopasya api chāndasa tvena eva upapādanīya tve
translated: When the matup affix is resorted to by the matup section, the elision of the yat affix can also be explained only as a Vedic usage.

analyzed: lāghavāt matup vidheḥ eva dṛṣṭa anuvidhiḥ chandasi iti sṛji vacanena anitya tā kalpanā aucityāt atas
translated: Due to simplicity, it is proper to assume the impermanence by the word sṛji (create) itself, as the rule regarding the matup affix is seen to be a rule for Vedic usage.

original: lakṣaṇayaiva strīliṅgānurodhāt sṛṣṭimantropadheyeṣṭakāparaḥ sṛṣṭiśabda ityevoktaṃ kaustubhe /🔽yattu atra liṅgaprakaraṇābhyāmevānyamantravadeṣo 'pi prāpta iti prāptānyaparisaṅkhyāyāṃ traidoṣyāpattiritaramantrāmnānavaiyarthyāpattiśceti
analyzed: lakṣaṇayā eva strī liṅga anurodhāt sṛṣṭi mantra upadheya iṣṭakā paraḥ sṛṣṭi śabdaḥ iti eva uktam kaustubhe  yat tu atra liṅga prakaraṇābhyām eva anya mantra vat eṣaḥ pi prāptaḥ iti prāpta anya parisaṅkhyāyām traidoṣya āpattiḥ itara mantra āmnāna vaiyarthya āpattiḥ ca iti
translated: Therefore, it is said in the Kautsa Ubhaja that the word sṛṣṭi (creation) refers to the bricks to be laid down in the creation mantra, in accordance with the feminine gender, only through secondary meaning.🔽As for the argument that by the gender and context, this [mantra] is obtained like other mantras, and if it is a restriction of what is already obtained, then the fault of having three faults and the uselessness of mentioning other mantras would result -

analyzed: tat na liṅga prakaraṇa kalpya śruteḥ pūrvam eva etad vidhi pravṛttyā phalataḥ parisaṅkhyāyām
translated: That is not so. Even before the assumed hearing by gender and context, this injunction operates, and thus it is a restriction in effect.

analyzed: traidoṣya aprasakteḥ grahaṇa ādi śeṣi parisaṅkhyā artha tvena api punar vidhi upapatteḥ ca itara mantrāṇām aikāntika upadhāna liṅga abhāvena iṣṭakā grahaṇa ādi viṣaya tvena
translated: And because the injunction is possible again by the meaning of enumeration of the remaining parts such as taking, etc., by the meaning of including the mantra which is not connected with the three faults, and because the other mantras are capable of having meaning by the absence of the indication of exclusive placing and by the object of taking bricks, etc.

analyzed: sārthakya saṃbhavāt ca
translated: And because it is possible.

analyzed: atas sṛṣṭi mantra vidhāyaka tvena vidhi upapatteḥ na vidhau gauṇī lakṣaṇa āpādakam asṛṣṭi mantra paratvam āśrayaṇīyam
translated: Therefore, because the injunction is possible by the meaning of the injunction of the creation mantra, the meaning of not creating the mantra which causes the figurative meaning in the injunction should not be relied upon.

analyzed: tathā api ubhayoḥ dhātvartha upapadārthayoḥ saṃbhavat prāptika tve bhāva artha adhikaraṇa nyāyena ākṣepataḥ
translated: Even so, when both the meaning of the root and the meaning of the prefix are possible to be obtained, by the principle of the section on the meaning of being,

original: pūrvaṃ prayojanāntarārthaṃ yuktaṃ dhātvarthasyaiva vidhānaṃ ityabhipretya bhāṣyakārīyaṃ
analyzed: pūrvam prayojana antara artham yuktam dhātvarthasya eva vidhānam iti abhipretya bhāṣyakārīyam
translated: it is proper to enjoin first the meaning of the root alone for the purpose of another purpose. With this in mind, the commentator

analyzed: siddhāntam eva āha tatra ca iti
translated: states the conclusion in tatra ca (in that case).

analyzed: upadhāna vidhāna prayojana nirūpaṇam
translated: The determination of the purpose of the injunction of placing.
The word eva (only) indicates the rejection of the prima facie view stated earlier regarding the injunction of the mantra.

analyzed: artha prāptasya api upadhānasya iṣṭakā sādhya tvena tad saṃskāra tva asaṃbhavāt tad artham punar vidhānam iti āha iṣṭakā saṃskāra artha tvena iti
translated: Because the placing, which is obtained by the meaning, cannot be a refinement of that due to being accomplished by bricks, it is enjoined again for that purpose. It is said for the purpose of refining the bricks.

analyzed: nanu pradhāna bhede pi prayoga vidhi avagata sāhitya nirvāha artham yathāśakti pātra abhimarśana vat samudita upadhānam eva
translated: But even when there is a difference in the principal, it is proper to have the combined placing as in the case of touching the vessels, in order to fulfill the association understood from the injunction of performance, according to ability.

analyzed: yuktam iti āśaṅkya tad nirāsāya aniṣṭa āpādanena prayojana antaram āha ārthika tvāt ca iti
translated: Fearing this doubt, in order to refute it, he states another purpose by undesirable consequence, saying And because it is meaningful.

analyzed: tat eva āha sati tu iti
translated: He says that in satitva (existence).

analyzed: vyūha viśeṣeṇa upasthāna rūpa upadhānasya ārthika tve vihita tva rūpa aṅga tvasya kṛṣi ādi vat abhāvāt cayane  adhvaryu kartṛ tvena samāna kartṛka tvasya ca anya kṛtena api sandhukṣaṇa ādinā devadatte pāka kartṛ tvasya iva iha api avāntaravyāpāra rūpa upadhānasya anya
translated: If the placing in the form of attendance by a special arrangement were meaningful, and there were no subsidiary nature in the form of being enjoined, like in agriculture etc.,🔽and there were the same agent in the form of the Adhvaryu priest, even when kindled by another, like the agent of cooking for Devadatta, so too here, even though the placing in the form of an intermediate operation is done by another,

analyzed: kṛta tve pi cayane adhvaryu kartṛka tva upapatteḥ niyamena adhvaryu kartṛ tva aprāpteḥ aṅga tvena vidhānam āvaśyakam
translated: the Adhvaryu priest can perform the placing. Therefore, because the Adhvaryu priest is not necessarily obtained as the agent, the injunction as a subsidiary is necessary.

analyzed: tatas ca aṅga pradhānayoḥ eka kartṛ tvāt tad siddhiḥ
translated: And from that, because the principal and the subsidiary have the same agent, that is established.

analyzed: ataeva prathana ādi vidheḥ iva ādhvaryava samākhyā viṣaya tā siddhi dvārā adhvaryu kartṛ tva siddhiḥ api nā eva prayojanam
translated: For this very reason, the establishment of the Adhvaryu priest as the agent through the establishment of being the object of the designation Adhvaryava is not even a purpose, like the injunction of spreading etc.

analyzed: cayana samāna kartṛ tvāt eva tad lābhāt
translated: Because the attainment of that is itself by the fact of having the same performer as the piling up.

analyzed: atas cayana samāna kartṛ tva siddhiḥ eva prayojanam iti arthaḥ
translated: And hence the establishment of having the same performer as the piling up is itself the purpose. This is the meaning.🔽The method of taking the created and uncreated mantras by the word 'creation'

analyzed: sṛṣṭi padam ca yadi api viśeṣya aṃśena uddeśya samarpakam sṛṣṭi mantra aṃśena anuvādakam
translated: Although the word 'creation' is a designator of the object to be specified by the part that is specified, it is a restatement by the part of the creation mantra.

original: te ca mantrāḥ sṛṣṭīrupadadhātītyupakramyai kayāstuvata prajā adhīyante tyādinā saptadaśa paṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: te ca mantrāḥ sṛṣṭīḥ upadadhāti iti upakramyai kayā astuvata prajāḥ adhīyante tyādinā saptadaśa paṭhitāḥ
translated: And those mantras are recited as seventeen beginning with 'He lays down the creations' and ending with 'By which they praised, offspring were born'.

original: tatra tisṛbhirastuvata brahmāsṛjyata ityādinā sṛjidhātuyogenāmnātānāṃ caturdaśamantrāṇāṃ

analyzed: mukhya tvam prathama śruta tvāt asaṃjāta virodhi tvam anadhigata artha bodhaka tvāt aprāpta arthaka tvam  ca iti hetu trayam sūcayitvā arthavādasya stāvaka tvāt amukhya tvam carama śruta tvāt upasaṃjāta virodhi tvam
translated: The three reasons indicated are: primacy due to being mentioned first, non-contradiction of what is not yet born, and the power to convey unknown meanings.🔽The three reasons for weakness are shown: the subordination of the explanatory passage due to its being a praise, the contradiction of what is already born due to being mentioned last,

original: jātārthatvāt prāptārthānuvāditvaṃ ceti daurbalye hetutrayaṃ darśitam /

original: paśumālabheteti vidheḥ paśusāmānyavidhāyakasya chāgasya vapāyā medaso 'nubrūhi iti mantravarṇānurodhena saṃkoce 'pi nātra tasyodāharaṇatvam
analyzed: paśum ālabheta iti vidheḥ paśu sāmānya vidhāyakasya chāgasya vapāyāḥ medasaḥ nubrūhi iti mantra varṇa anurodhena saṃkoce pi nā atra tasya udāharaṇa tvam
translated: Even though there is a restriction of the injunction one should sacrifice an animal which prescribes the general rule for animals, in accordance with the mantra text recite for the fat of the goat's omentum, this is not an example here.

original: tatra vākyaikavākyatayā vidhimantrayorekaviṣayatvasyaṣaṣṭhāntye pratipādanena paunaruktyāpatteriti sūcanāyārthavādenetyuktam /
analyzed: tatra vākya ekavākyatayā vidhi mantrayoḥ eka viṣaya tvasya ṣaṣṭha antye pratipādanena paunaruktya āpatteḥ iti sūcanāya arthavādena iti uktam
translated: In order to indicate that there would be a repetition by teaching in the sixth and last [verse] that the mantra and injunction have the same object by being one sentence in the sentence, it is said by the explanatory passage.

Refutation of the superiority of the explanatory passage by the principle of eating from a bronze vessel.

original: nanu kāṃsyabhojinyāyena aṅgabhūtārthavādānurodhitvameva vidherastvityāśaṅkāparihārāya saṅkocapadaṃ prayuktam /

translated: The word 'restriction' is used to remove the doubt that the injunction should be restricted to conform to the explanatory passages which are subordinate to it, like the injunction to eat from a bronze vessel.

original: yatra guṇavidhinā pradhānasya na kiñcit bādhyate /
analyzed: yatra guṇavidhinā pradhānasya na kiñcid bādhyate

analyzed: tatra eva kāṃsya bhoji nyāyaḥ

translated: But in the present case, since there would be the contradiction in the form of restriction of the principal rite, that principle does not apply.🔽Just as the injunction is restricted to the three varnas in accordance with the fact that the agnihotra etc. are to be accomplished by the knowledge of agni etc., similarly, since the injunction is to be accomplished by the explanatory passages, the restriction of the injunction is not rejected in accordance with them.

analyzed: etena agni vidyā sādhyasya agnihotra ādeḥ tad anurodhena traivarṇika viṣaya tayā saṅkoca vat iha api vidhānasya arthavāda sādhya tvāt tad anurodhena
translated: By this, just as the agnihotra etc. which are to be accomplished by the knowledge of agni are restricted to the three varnas in accordance with that, similarly here also, since the injunction is to be accomplished by the explanatory passages,

translated: Even if contraction is accepted, here, without a commendatory statement, the injunction itself can be assumed to have the power to delight, and thus the injunction can be established. Therefore, there is no need for that.

translated: The determination that the contraction of the injunction is not due to the conformity of the meaning of the commendatory statement, but due to the conformity of the subsidiary mantra, like the taking of Soma.

original: ataśca yathā indrāya tvā vasumate gṛhṇāmītyaindramantrasādhyasyāpi somagrahaṇasya
analyzed: atas ca yathā indrāya tvā vasumate gṛhṇāmi iti aindra mantra sādhyasya api soma grahaṇasya
translated: And therefore, just as the taking of Soma, which is accomplished by the mantra I take for you Indra, the possessor of wealth,

analyzed: soma grahaṇasya aindra pradhāna mātra viṣaya tvena saṅkocaḥ iti tṛtīye liṅga viśeṣa nirdeśāt iti adhikaraṇe vakṣyate
translated: taking of Soma, by limiting it to the principal Indra alone, due to the conformity of the subsidiary mantra, as will be stated in the section Due to the indication of a particular mark in the third (A ..).

analyzed: tadvat aṅga bhūta arthavāda anurodhena pradhāna bhūta vidheḥ saṅkocaḥ na yuktaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: In the same way, the contraction of the principal injunction due to the conformity of the subsidiary commendatory statement is not proper. This is the meaning.

analyzed: sūtra gatena sandigdha padena avyavasthita artha grahaṇam iti nirūpaṇam
translated: The determination that the word doubtful in the sutra refers to the grasping of a meaning that is not fixed.

analyzed: sandigdha artha nirṇaye iti
translated: The ascertainment of a doubtful meaning.

original: yadyapi pūrvapakṣe sāmānyarūpatayā niścayāt siddhānte caikavākyatayā dhṛtarūpatvaniścayātsandehāsaṃbhave
analyzed: yadi api pūrvapakṣe sāmānya rūpa tayā niścayāt siddhānte ca eka vākya tayā dhṛta rūpa tva niścayāt sandeha asaṃbhave

translated: and the absence of doubtful meaning does not justify the conclusion of the negation of the invalidity of the doubtful meaning accepted by the proponent of the conclusion,

original: tathāpi sandigdhaśabdena sūtragatenāvyavasthitārthapratītimātrasya vivakṣaṇāt vidhyuddeśamātraparāmarśāt🔽bhavantī sā pratītiḥ yathā vākyaśeṣāvadhāritayā vyavasthayā siddhāntinā vāryate /

analyzed: tad dvārā ca prāmāṇyam arthavādasya sādhyate tatra

analyzed: kintu avyavasthita artha pratītiḥ eva yuktā iti arthaḥ  arthavāda gata ghṛta padasya gauṇa tva lākṣaṇika tva upalakṣaṇa tva ādinā upapattiḥ pūrvapakṣe

analyzed: athavā añjana sādhanatva saṃbandhena lākṣaṇikam eva vā
translated: Or else, it is only figurative in relation to the connection with the nature of an ointment.

translated: Or, since ghee is also obtained in general, it is only about ghee that is being referred to by separating it out.

original: sāmānyāṃśe vidheḥ stāvakatvakalpane 'pi ghṛtāṃśe tadakalpanayā stāvakameva //🔽liṅgasamavāyād ghṛtapadalakṣakatvamiti nyāyasudhākārādimatakhaṇḍanena yenakenacidañjanamiti pūrvapakṣopasaṃhāraḥ🔽yattu atra nyāyasudhākārādīnāṃ liṅgasamavāyāt gauṇatvapratipādanaṃ /

translated: Even if the injunction is assumed to be praise in the general part, it is only praise in the part about ghee by not assuming it there.🔽The conclusion of the prima facie view that it is co-reference with the word 'añjana' by the rule of co-reference with the word 'ghee' is refuted by the opinion of Nyāyasudhākara and others.

original: tadañjanasādhanadravyāṇāmeka samudāyasya sattve pramāṇābhāvenānyatamasya sādhanatvānupapatteśca ghṛtacihnasaṃbandhāsaṃbhavādupekṣaṇīyam /

translated: However, the explanation by Nyāyasudhākara and others that it is figurative because of co-reference is to be disregarded, since there is no evidence for the existence of a single aggregate of the substances that are the means of applying collyrium, and because the relation of being connected with the mark 'ghee' is impossible due to the impossibility of any one of them being the means.

analyzed: etena alpatvasya api atra nimitta tvam pratyuktam
translated: By this, the cause of smallness here is also refuted.

original: evañca sāmānyasya viśeṣavyabhicāritvena tallakṣakatvānupapatterviśeṣeṇa sāmānyāvyabhicāriṇā sāmānyalakṣaṇopapatteryena kenacidañjanamiti siddham
analyzed: evam ca sāmānyasya viśeṣa vyabhicāri tvena tad lakṣaka tva anupapatteḥ viśeṣeṇa sāmānya avyabhicāriṇā sāmānya lakṣaṇa upapatteḥ yena kenacid añjanam iti siddham
translated: And thus, since the general is contradicted by the particular, it cannot be the indicator of that. Since the particular is not contradicted by the general, the indication of the general is possible. Therefore, it is established that it is collyrium by some means.

original: ākṣepataḥ pūrvamevārthavādena ghṛtasyāñjanasādhanatvenānvayāt na yena kenacidañjanamiti siddhāntopakramaḥ🔽sāmānyena vyavahārāsaṃbhavādvidheranuṣṭhāpakatvanirvāhāya yāvadviśeṣākṣepakatvaṃ

translated: The conclusion is that since ghee is connected as the means of collyrium by the explanatory passage itself earlier by implication, not by any collyrium.🔽Since usage is not possible in general, the injunction must be established as prompting only to the extent that it implicates the particulars.

analyzed: kalpanīyam tāvat prarocanā samarpaka tayā avaśya apekṣitena eka vākya tā āpanna artha vādena eva
translated: To that extent, by the explanatory passage itself, which is necessarily required as indicating the inducement, and which is syntactically connected,

analyzed: tad apekṣā śānteḥ tad samarpita viśeṣa para tayā vidheḥ na yuktam vyavasthāpanam
translated: it is not proper to establish the injunction as having the particular indicated by it as its purport, since the expectation based on that is satisfied by that.

analyzed: saṅkocasya vyavahāra anumata tvena svārtha tayā eva apekṣaṇāt
translated: Because the restriction is accepted as usage, it is expected only as its own meaning.

analyzed: atas eva atra na upakrameṇa upasaṃhāra gata artha vādasya upamarda lakṣaṇa bādhaḥ
translated: For this very reason, here there is no contradiction in the form of the sublation of the meaning of the explanatory passage in the conclusion by the introductory passage.

analyzed: nava upasaṃhāreṇa upakramasya saṅkoca lakṣaṇaḥ bādhaḥ
translated: Nor is there contradiction in the form of restriction of the introductory passage by the conclusion.

original: evañca vidheḥ prarocanāśaktirapi na kalpitā bhavati /
analyzed: evam ca vidheḥ prarocanā śaktiḥ api na kalpitā bhavati
translated: And thus, the power of inducement of the injunction is not imagined either.

original: ghṛtaprarocanayā samāpte vākye kālpanikyā tailādiprarocanayā vākyāntarārthatāpattyā vākyabhedāpattiśca naprasajyate ityabhipretya siddhāntamāha
analyzed: ghṛta prarocanayā samāpte vākye kālpanikyā taila ādi prarocanayā vākya antara artha tā āpattyā vākya bheda āpattiḥ ca na prasajyate iti abhipretya siddhāntam āha
translated: And the contingency of syntactical split due to the implication of another meaning by the figurative sense of ghee, or by the figurative sense of oil etc. at the end of the sentence, is not incurred. With this in view, he states the conclusion:

analyzed: vidheḥ aviśeṣa iti
translated: By the non-distinction of the injunction.

analyzed: upakrama ākāṅkṣayā eva artha vādasya upapattau na ghṛta padasya taila ādi upalakṣaka tvam iti

translated: Just as in the case of the injunctions One should praise with the Saman and One should praise with the Ṛc, the Ṛc is not to be praised, so too here the same object is to be praised.

original: ata eva yatra somena yajeteti vidhernairākāṅkṣyaṃ /
analyzed: atas eva yatra somena yajeta iti vidheḥ nairākāṅkṣyam
translated: For this very reason, where the injunction One should sacrifice with Soma is complete,

translated: there the mantra, which is a subordinate factor, is not restricted to being about the mere gift to Indra, in accordance with the mantra.

original: evañcopakramākāṅkṣayaivārthavādasyānvayopapattau tatra ghṛtapadasya lakṣaṇāṅgīkaraṇaṃ niṣprayojanaṃ niṣpramāṇakaṃ cetyāha upasaṃhārasthasyeti
analyzed: evam ca upakrama ākāṅkṣayā eva artha vādasya anvaya upapattau tatra ghṛta padasya lakṣaṇa aṅgīkaraṇam niṣprayojanam niṣpramāṇakam ca iti āha upasaṃhāra sthasya iti
translated: And thus, when the Arthavada is established by the requirement of the beginning itself, the figurative sense of the word ghee there is accepted as purposeless and without evidence. He says: Of that which is at the end.

analyzed: eka viṣaya tvasya iti
translated: Of the same object.

original: yathā yadṛcā stuvate tadasurā anvavāyanyatsāmnā stuvīta tadasurā nānvavāyanni tyarthavāde kimasurāgamanahetutvenātra nindyate /
analyzed: yathā yat ṛcā stuvate tat asurāḥ anvavāyan yat sāmnā stuvīta tat asurāḥ na anvavāyan iti arthavāde kim asura āgamana hetu tvena atra nindyate
translated: As in the case of the Rg verse, when they praise with the Rg, the Asuras follow them; if they were to praise with the Saman, the Asuras would not follow them. Is the Rg verse here condemned as the cause of the Asuras coming,

analyzed: uta vaśīkartum aśakyānām asurāṇām api vaśīkaraṇa hetutayā stutiḥ iti sandigdhe tad anantara śrutena  yaḥ evam vidvān sāmnā astuvīta iti sāma viṣayeṇa vidhinā vidhitsita sāma praśaṃsā artham ṛc
translated: or is it praised as the means of subjugating even the Asuras who are difficult to subdue? In doubt, by what is heard immediately after that,

original: nindyate ityavadhāryate tannindāparatva eva tadekavākyatopapatteriti navame arthaikatvādityadhikaraṇe vakṣyate /
analyzed: nindyate iti avadhāryate tad nindā paratve eva tad ekavākyatā upapatteḥ iti navame artha ekatvāt iti adhikaraṇe vakṣyate

analyzed: evam iha api eka viṣaya tva anurodhena vidheḥ api vyavasthāpanam iti arthaḥ
translated: Similarly, here also, in accordance with the requirement of having the same object, even the injunction is established by the Arthavada with regard to the object whose meaning is doubtful. This is the meaning.

original: uktañca vārtike tatraiva vidhistutyoḥ sadā vṛttiḥ samānaviṣayeṣyate /

translated: And it is said in the Vartika there itself: The operation of injunction and praise is always considered to be on the same object.

analyzed: tasmāt ekatra sandigdham itareṇa avadhāryate
translated: Therefore, when it is doubtful in one, it is ascertained by the other.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: saṃdigdha padena avyavasthitam sa deha viṣayaḥ ca ubhayam api vivakṣitam
translated: By the word doubtful, both the undetermined and the object of the body are meant.

original: ataeva ādityaḥ prāyaṇīya yadāgneya ityādau ca aditidevatātvairṇayaḥ ityādi nirūpaṇam
analyzed: ataeva ādityaḥ yat āgneyaḥ ityādau ca ityādi nirūpaṇam
translated: Therefore, in passages like The sun is the Prāyaṇīya, because it is connected with Agni, the determination of the deity as Aditi is stated.

translated: And in this aphorism, the doubt that is well-known by the word doubtful and that which is the cognition of an indefinite meaning, both are intended to be denoted as doubt.

analyzed: anavadhāraṇa rūpa tva aviśeṣāt
translated: Because there is no difference in the form of non-determination.

original: ata evoktam vyavarāhādhikaraṇavārtike sandigdheṣu ca sarveṣu vākyaśeṣeṇa nirṇayam /
analyzed: atas eva uktam vyavarāhādhikaraṇa vārtike sandigdheṣu ca sarveṣu vākya śeṣeṇa nirṇayam
translated: For this very reason it is said in the Vārtika on the section on Vyavahāra: And in all doubtful cases, the decision is by the remainder of the sentence.

original: vakṣyatyeva na tenātra pṛthakkāryā vicāraṇā iti /
analyzed: vakṣyati eva na tena atra pṛthak kāryā vicāraṇā iti
translated: He will speak, therefore, no separate consideration is to be made here by that.
